text:
I went there for buffet twice. Moving from NYC hub of Indian restaurant, I am ought to be biased. I certainly have had better food. It gets crowded on weekend, wait time could be overwhelming. 

Food was okay there were plenty of dishes to try, Chicken tikka was good. The appetizer is average. Tandoori chicken was okay could have been better. The goat curry was not something I would recommend some one. Vegetarian dishes were better than the non vegetarian dishes. 

I was actually surprised to see it so crowded.

My girlfriend and I have been to Persis 4-5 times.  Based on my first few experiences, after it first opened, I would not have rated it this high.  Although the food was great, the service was poor and our server had a very difficult time understanding our order.  Also each dish took far to long to be served.  

Since then, they have certainly figured it out.  Our service has been excellent the past couple times we've gone.  Joseph is extremely friendly and more than happy to explain menu items and spice levels.  The manager came around to ask us how we were doing and the food came out much quicker.  So from a service standpoint, Persis is doing it right.

As for the food, it has always been outstanding.  Of the appetizers, I've tried the samosas, garlic chicken, fried jalapenos, and button mushrooms.  For entree, there are to many to name, but my favorite is the Chana Masala.  Also, they do not have Dal Makhani on the menu; however Joseph had it specially made for us.  

I would give this 4 1/2 stars if it were available.  I highly recommend it and I promise you will not be disappointed.

We can find new biryanis here:

Chicken 65 + biryani rice = boneless biryani
Lamb curry + biryani rice= lamb biryani, 

Buffet specials is always with out biryani. Once upon a time food is good . But now just it is a money making restaurant.
First time here after moving back to Charlotte. Absolutely loved it. Everything we ordered was so awesome. Biriyani is a must have here. I so wish that this place is near our home!

The tikka massala is on point but the Butter Chicken is where it's at!  I have tried several Indian food establishments in Charlotte and this is by far the best both for the lunch buffet and the evening service which feature large portions and informative service.  Dang now I've gone and made myself hungry :-)

This is the best Indian restaurant in Charlotte by far! Recommended to us by an Indian friend & all Indians eating there so you know it will be the real deal! Wait staff is very friendly & nice & they love to give suggestions on what to order. Our server , Joseph, did not steer us wrong . If you have ever eaten at the Indian Garden in Chicago, Persis is just as good, if not better. And it's a lot closer!!

Imagine you have to wait for food for more than an hour after being seated. I dont go the place again if service is poor (I never have high expectation from any Indian restaurants for service but this was extreme on low side)

Food here was better compared to other similar restaurants in the area. 
I tried some of their veg dishes like Kadai paneer, malai kofta and biryani are good.
There was good time last year but new folks messed up all. Late services , order mix ups, bad conduct all are best practices now a days... Don't waste time and money.

Woohoo!! I had been longing to have good, authentic biryani and Voila!! I tried their Vegetarian Biryani, Paneer 65 and Dal Tadka today. It really reminded me of the Hyderabadi Biryani that I ate in Hyderabad years ago. Everything was delicious and  items were priced ok. They also delivered the food with a $2 delivery charge which isnt too bad..though I stay so close that I might just pick it up myself next time. Overall, great food and a good addition to the gourmet dining in Ballantyne, Charlotte. Hoping they keep the standards.

Most pathetic Indian food I have ever had in US. We went there on a Thursday night with unlimited kabobs, horrible undercooked kabobs and very bad indiochinese food. I would never ever visit this place again. And to top it all the service is very bad.

quality of food can at times vary; majority of times, its been good to ok; spiciness can be adjusted and can be brought up to the "real indian spicy" level! lunch buffet is ok; ambience could have been better.

I love the food here. Their Tikka Marsala is my favorite in town. I have ordered to go many times but only eaten in once. The service for both was very good. You cant beat the price and portion size. Entrees are several dollars less than others in the area.

I have some complaints.
I can not eat enough in one sitting to make it worthwhile for me to do a buffet. I like to take mine home and will eat my leftovers. They do not allow you to order off the menu during buffet.
You also can not order to go during buffet which has forced me to go to Blue Taj on these occasions.
I also wish the did not shut down between lunch and dinner shifts. I don't eat lunch til late when they've already closed.

The best in Charlotte...paneer chilly highly recommend. Malai kofta and veg biryani were very tasty.. Most of the veg options have turned out to be quite tasty.. 
The buffet is also good.. Very good service..

I have eaten their buffet lunch seven times now. Great food and great selection. They change it up so it isn't the same menu each time. The only reason I would give them a 4/5 is some times the food gets a little old toward the end of the buffet. Haven't tried their dinner yet.
Biriyani is real good. Goat is awesome. Medium is a bit spicy on biriyani. Kebabs are good. Naan is ok, curries are ok. Ambience is below the mark and service can be better.

Excellent Indian cuisine.  I have not tried the buffet yet, however the food off the menu was great.  We started with samosas for appetizers.  I had the chicken tika masala and it was delicious.   The naan bread was buttery and very tasty.  I plan to go back and give the buffet a try.

Our first time at Persis Indian Grill was a very nice experience.  Our server Joseph was extremely helpful with choices.  He will tell you his name really is Joseph and not a made up name.  The food was very yummy, we will be back again.

Great food!! This place serves delicious authentic Indian. One servers name is Joseph and he told us how his wife and young daughter are in India and he is working to get the money to get them to the U.S. Anyway this place Is really good!
Quality and taste is degraded. Its no more like before. Never ever order Andhra chicken curry from their menu, that's the worst thing you would have ever had.

Don't even think of eating here. Worst quality Indian food. It's basically a to-go place but doesn't do any justice for what you pay. I've had more than two people say the same. I've ended up having gastric problems all three times I've eaten here. Avoid to save yourself health and money.

Just had the Veg Biryani....it was stale , had to throw the entire thing.

The veg combo option looked better, maybe should have taken that.

I like all about the persis, ..authentic Hyderabad biryani, south Indian food and Nice buffet.

All-in-all one must visit..

Loved the courteous service. food  was amazing. Felt the real taste of Biryani. 
Had ordered gobi Manchurian and vegetable dum Biryani. Enjoyed both the dishes.

I was out on a date and the young lady I was with said she was craving Indian food so we decided to stop in and check this place out. I couldn't be happier that we found this gem. The food was fantastic; some of the most flavorful food I've ever eaten. On top of the mouth watering deliciousness of their menu selections, the service was top notch! I'll definitely be visiting them when I'm in that area again.
Good service .. buffet food is NO Salt and NO spicy.  I would skip the buffet and try the dinner. Ensure you tell them Indian Spicy or else you would get with NO salt

Love this place! Incredibly nice staff, amazing food, felt very comforts and have never been disappointed. When they ask you how hot they are not kidding! Love to say hot and actually enjoy the fact it will be hot, so if you don't like it too spicy, don't even ask for a 3. Slow service but worth the wait!

Was here for lunch on a Sunday and they had a buffet going on. The ambience was pretty standard with full wall mirrors on one side, that give you a feeling of depth and size. The place was reasonably crowded and I noticed several folks walk in even as we were having our lunch. The food itself was fairly substandard....the only highlight being the gobi manchurian (which was right on spot) and the yellow dal that was on the buffet. The pani puri seemed totally off (something was totally amiss here); the vegetable biriyani barely hit the mark; the mushroom curry was only namesake - one had to fish for a piece of mushroom in a sea of soya nuggets; the mango lassi that was served on the table wasn't upto it; and then I kept some hopes for the mango mousse that was on the dessert section - only to be let down. The mango mousse turned out to be a much thicker and sweeter version of the mango lassi. Cannot say anything about the non-vegetarian dishes on the buffet, but the veg section was a let down.

Had an urge for some good Indian food - called this place for a takeout - the manager took the time to explain the menu and also made a couple of suggestions - I ended up ordering goat byriani and spinach with cheese -both dishes were amazing. Byriani was fresh and smelled amazing my two kids immediately demanded to try some - goat meat was tender and perfectly cooked. Spinach and cheese was outstanding - perfect consistency and great flavor along with a hint of cumin in it. Overall great restaurant - if you dine In ask for Joseph - great waiter and take out is also convenient

Visiting Charlotte on business and found this place by happenstance.  I had an absolutely fantastic dinner.  For all you naysayers of the lunch buffet you are missing out.   Dinner was of excellent quality and explosive flavors having tried chicken Chettinad and lamb Maharaja.  The rosemary naan was addictive.       

I do not claim to be an expert on Indian food but based on the fact the dining room was full of what appeared to be patrons of Indian descent I thought that was a good sign.  We saw many delicious dishes pass our table and asked the other diners what they ordered.  Everyone was friendly and cordial and now I know what I will be ordering next time I come dine here.

Food arrived timely and steaming hot, our waiter continuously checked on us, refilled  beverages, took additional orders, and was very attentive.  

For those critics that put emphasis on decor and ice in their water I think you are misguided and missing the dining experience.   Should you ever venture out of your comfortable neighborhood and travel the world you will be disappointed because its not about the furniture or the ice cubes.
Awesome flavor, but guys u can't have all the chicken curries in the buffet with mainly bones and and no real meat.

Inconsistent and over priced. Sometimes food is ok and sometimes bad. Seems like the chef is changing often. Food is over spiced and there is way too much salt in the food. Eaten at much better indian restaurants.

Best meal I've had in Charlotte. Stopped in for dinner and had a terrific experience.

Nice atmosphere, great menu, terrific service at very reasonable price.

We had onion pakoda appetizer, chicken tikka and navrathan korma entrees.
Food prepared perfectly and was simply delicious.

Service attentive but not over bearing.

Prices very reasonable. Good beer and wine selection

All in all, a great experience and will certainly be back again!

Persis  in ballantyne no consistency everytime food tastes different and all hygiene lovers they store food containers in restrroms. Service is below par but I could live with that if food quality is better which is not at all. If its your you will get good food or else it would suck. I would try something else if I want good food for sure.

We had noticed this place several times driving by, and we had read all of the positive reviews, so last night we finally decided to give it a try.

All we can say, is "wow!". They make a nice atmosphere, and the service is very friendly and attentive. Our server made some very good suggestions about what to order.

The food was simply amazing.  Very fresh, very nice spice, and so wonderfully seasoned. Very flavorful and great texture. We had the paneer tikka, idly, hakka noodles, daal tad aka, navrathan korma, and three different kinds of bread: butter naan, roti, and onion kulcha. All of it perfect - the best I have ever tried outside of India itself.

We can't wait to return.

Never go here for dinner. My family went here for dinner and it took them 45 minutes to bring our food while the people around us who came much later were instantly served. The staff quality was bad too. The waiter  dropped my food and spilled my water on me and all I got  was a sarcastic sounding sorry. The food was alright but Passage to India closeby is much better in terms of customer service and quality.I will never eat at Persis again.

I had a buffet lunch here on a weekend and it was really good.Being a non vegetarian ,i had all the options from mutton curry to chicken biryani etc.
The gulab jamuns were exceptional ,liked them a lot .
Wha i did not like there was the pan which was sold at the counter ,somehow it was a little bitter in taste.

Just had a FABULOUS Indian feast!
The lunch buffet is nothing short of delicious! Known for their biryani dish
The veggie and chicken served is spiced perfectly with just the right amount of kick. The tiki masala is rich and creamy and the curry dishes are delicious!
Highly recommend for those who love Indian food! Yummy
Definitely coming back!!

This is my favorite Indian restaurant and as it is my favorite food at this present time, l have tried all Indian restaurants in Charlotte and surrounding areas. We have around 5-6 Indian restaurants in the university area where l live. To me this is the best. Right now l have 6 restaurants close to me and 4 of them are on my street!! Lucky me!!! I always eat the buffet because l love trying all the interesting dishes. Many Indians eat here too!

Great food. I had the goat curry.My wife had the chicken tikka masala and she loved it.Ohh my mama,excellent food !Plus the chai( tea) that was superb . I'm from East Africa and that was close to home .Why fly home when I can dine here.
I almost went to the kitchen to clap for the chef and pop his collar..
Only thing I didn't like which is not a big deal, I wish our waiter greeted us.But she was good overall, thereafter. After all we went to eat and they fed us well.

This place really disappointed me today.. i love there food and specially went to have der biryani..ordered the food at 9:30.. in few mins they say rice is over..then i madeup my mind to noodles..what pissed me off was they didt even had noodles..we jus left the place without have any food..by this time we were left with very few options outside..not happy at all

This is the best Indian cuisine we've had in the Charlotte area. The Daal Bukhara is rich and satisfying with lovely heat. The Aloo Gobhi, also vegetarian, had subtle flavors and a great balance of heat and texture. We had a very helpful and attentive server, Nick, as was the rest of the staff. Highly recommend! Please join us in keeping this northland gem busy!

looking for a place to go on Monday night when our normal place was closed we found this gem.  the staff is very attentive and made some wonderful recommendations.  they even catered to us due to some food allergies, going so far to check in the kitchen and even bring out some ingredients to verify that they would meet our needs.  then there was the food! some of the best Indian food we've had in the Charlotte area.  we are already planning another trip with friends.  The best Indian restaurant in the university area.

Chicken Biryani or bone biryani?
Biryani rice mixed with white rice along with couple of chicken bones for $10.71 . Avoid. Attaching a photo as well
Some dishes like paneer kadai and dal fry are so bad and these are too regular dishes.  Seriously they need a good chef !
Really good!  Introduced to Indian food in Austin and I've been looking for a good place in Charlotte for a while. This is it!
In the top 3 BEST Chicken Tikka Masala I have ever had! Very robust and rich flavor. Check out this place, you will love it!

Best value! Chicken biryani and chicken tikka masala with naan and a drink all for less than what I pay for one dish at other Indian restaurants. Food was delicious and better than many of the Indian restaurants around town. I will definitely be back.

taste rivals my favorite place Passage to India (University). Persis is a little more expensive BUT you do get more food for the money so it is definitely worth it.

Buffet is a little overpriced compared to most places. it is very good tho but a buffet for 30+ dollars is kind of ridiculous and won't go back for this.
Excellent food and service! Loved the Cauliflower appetizer! Definitely becoming a regular.
Unfortunately it's the worst Indian restaurant I've ever tasted. Greesy food and the goat biryani was bone & fat biryani. The side orders were not good either. Definitely do not recommend it.
Some of the best Indian food we've had in the US.  Authentic Indian food,  it's not Americanized. This is the real deal and delicious! Wish we lived in Ballantyne!

As it goes for Indian fare this is frankly one of the best I've had. This more than rivals the amazing Indian food I had in London; a gastronomic hotspot of Indian cuisine.  The flavors and spices are quite fantastic and satisfying. The okra and eggplant are so yummy! Best comfort food ever. Don't forget the Naan.
Great service. Very friendly staff. We are coming here for last 2 years and every time has great dining experience. Best Indian food in town.

Finally a Biriyani place for Charlotte ! 
We had Chilli Chicken and Chicken Biriyani, both were mind blowing ! This is easily the best biriyani you can get in Charlotte ! Biriyani portion was huge, well worth the $12 ish price.

The ambience is mundane, nothing special but does the job.Service staff are friendly but slow.  We got our food 25 minutes after we placed the order. But all these peeves vanish once you get the food ! Absolutely delicious !

Since they opened up recently on July 7th, they only have limited menu titled "Grand-Opening Menu". But that includes most of the famous/routine items. 

Will I go back again ? Hell Yeah !

NOTE: Their spice levels range from 1-6. The starters were pretty spicy with level 4 for me (I'm an Indian who can tolerate a decent amount of spice) . The biriyani was prefect with level 4 spice though !

UPDATE: 7/9/2013

After multiple visits, I have noticed that food tastes better in a la carte when compared to the lunch buffet.

Beware of this place! My boyfriend and I had the intention of only ordering one dish for the both of us to share. When I asked for a recommendation the guy instantly said that he was going to get us one curry chicken dish and one spinach dish. We didn't even have time to look it over! He went straight to the back. Then he came back with a shrimp appetizer that we didn't even ask for and a beer that was the most expensive one on the menu, which we didn't ask for either. After we ate our food our bill came up to be $61!!! We realized that he ordered the most expensive dishes on the menu!!! The server didn't speak English very well so we couldn't explain anything to him but after he ran our card our receipt went up to $77!! He gave himself a tip!! My boyfriend and I were so angry, but their was nothing we could do. The food was amazing but I will never be returning to this location again. We got completely ripped off.

By far the best Indian food in the area my wife and I have eaten at numerous Indian restaurants around the country and Persis is definitely worth the price of admission. The other restaurants In the area are ok but Persis is definitely better overall and the service and ambience are very friendly and welcoming. We had the buffet today and it was phenomenal there was plenty to choose from and everything tastes delicious and are authentic. Try it out you will be pleased you did.

So you want some good food huh?  Your in Charlotte at lunchtime and wondering where the best place you could fill your belly and enjoy the heck out of your food.  Well look no further than here.  The lunchtime buffet is worth every penny and then some.  The food is authentic (well as authentic as a person that travels a bunch and actually has some comparison to base this on can be).  From the goat curry, to the chi tea (handmade, not from a box). Everything is wonderful.  If they have it on the day you are here the egg curry or the mushroom curry will make you go weak in the knees.  So get up, get out and get there!
Very good Indian food. It was a little too spicy for some in my party but that is the chance you take with Indian food. I loved it and you can bet I will be back!

Hands down, this is the best casual Indian restraunt that I have found in the North Charlotte area.  Since I introduced my boyfriend to the incredible south Asian fare that is Indian a few years ago, we have become regulars at the lunch buffets in our area.  Persi's instantly became a hit from the first time we tried it in early December, soon after they opened.

The presentation of the food is absolutely gorgeous, with raw onions and fresh lime as an accompaniment choice and at least six different sauces to choose from - the cilantro sauce is my favorite, pureed to perfection and extremely fresh.  The Butter Chicken is a hit with everyone who I have taken there, but my favorite entree is the Paneer Saagwala.  The taste is exquisite with the homemade cream based sauce and tons of spinach throughout.  I cannot get enough of it, especially when they have it featured in the lunch buffet.  

The Naan is baked to perfection as well.  Slightly crunchy on the bottom where it sat on a stone but fluffy and dense on the top - its the best tool to soak up the rest of the rich sauces from the entrees or use it as a spoon to scoop up your meal.  

The grand finale for me is always the dessert.  With the lunch buffet, there is a different option daily.  The mango pudding is a delicious way to end, with a mouse-like consistency and a creamy taste that isn't overwhelmingly sweet.  The Shahi Tukra, a very rare treat to find, is absolutely to die for.  Bread soaked in regular and condensed milk with almonds and cardamom.. I don't eat bread very often, but this is definitely a time that I will splurge.

Prepare to go home fully stuffed and comforted after your meal.  The servers are always very attentive and the owner remembers us when we come in, making me feel welcome.  There's no better way to spend lunch - or if you are like my boyfriend and I who eat breakfast at 11:30, no better way to start your day.
Joseph was great! Very welcoming and the food is amazing. Great atmosphere!! I would recommend this place to anyone!!

The food is good, but I'd prefer it to be a bit more spicy. The reason for the 1 star review is because they charge a mandatory gratuity when you have 5 or more people.  The wait staff will fail to mention this until the check comes. I've never seen a restaurant charge a mandatory tip for as little as 5 people.... especially at buffet where you do most of the work yourself!!!

Top notch Indian cuisine in a very comfortable and hospitable environment.  Staff was very friendly and quick to make suggestions that appeared both on and off the menu.  I have dined in many different Indian restaurants in different cities and countries, and this place is among the best.

I took the best tips from those written and we also had Bhim the Mgr validate them. Food was great. We had Shrimp Biryani, Gobi 65, Chicken Kohrma and Kingfishers. Heat:3 Spicy enough to perspire but not too hot for us non-Indians. Overall: fantastic!

Our first time visiting Persis Indian Grill in Ballantyne can be summarized in three phases: delicious food, excellent service and a friendly family atmosphere. Our server, Murugan, even brought our daughter a complimentary mango drink since she was the only one unable to order alcohol. We started off with the Gobi Manchurian appetizer (super tasty) and also ordered Lamb Chops Tandoori, Eggplant Chettinadu and Tikka Masala to share around the table. It was so tasty that two days later we are still eating the leftovers!

Worst service EVER! We called in and placed an order for takeout. When we went to pick the order the guys shamelessly told us that they are OUT. How do you accept an order and then be out??? Very unprofessional staff. Stay away from this place.

I was really looking forward to eating at this restaurant until I got there. The service was not great at all, the waiter was trying to being a smart ass. The food quality is alright. There samosa chatt and gobi Manchurian is great but when it comes to the main meal it was whole different story. The paneer tikka masla barely had taste and there naans seemed frozen.
The take away can be slow but the food is excellent non the less. Best Indian restaurant in north Charlotte
This was my first Indian cuisine meal.   The food was full of flavor and a great variety on the buffet at lunch.   Will go back!

Worst experience in food quality and taste!!
Ordered many items. .none tasted good and non tasted like the actual dish name suggests..

O my dear god, where should I start, the service was disaster , food quality zero, dinning experience zero, the staff does not have anyyyyyyyyy knowledge, one star is a lot for that place, never ever again.

First of all they should really improve in their service . We ordered chicken lolly pop and tomato bisque. Lolly pop came around 15 minutes but that's ok since the taste was good and worth the wait. After so many enquires with the waiter we got the tomato bisque after 30 minutes which was not at all acceptable. When we asked why it is taking so long ? The waiter replied it's take time . Ufff... We didn't order the main course we left unhappy that day. But I have tasted 555 chicken before and it's pretty good . Don't bother to order vegetarian appetizers . Seriously, they don't know to make it . Briyani is good but you can get better briyanis in and around Charlotte. Hope they improve their service.
Food is Authentic!! I am so excited to finally have reasonable and delicious indian food in Charlotte. This place reminds of the kind of food I had in NY.

Awesome buffet for Indian, one of the better choices since they have variety in dishes and not the more traditional sides that you would normally see at other buffets. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is the price point. The going rate on a buffet has been 6.99-9.99 on weekends. This restaurants has a rate hike on Friday and another for Saturday and Sunday. The problem is they have not posted their prices anywhere. So knowing that Indian restaurants have different prices on the weekend I went on Monday and again on Friday (yes, its that delicious) to be caught off guard with the changes in price. To plan for a great customer experience, please post your buffet fee in your restaurant. This is the second time I have encountered this with the local Indian restaurants in this area.
Pros-great food, good service
Cons-I can't see how they justify hiking the price on Fridays with virtually no difference in the offering. I know its just a buck but still I am not sure its a 9.99 buffet to begin with.

My wife and a friend visited for the first time last night for dinner. Service was quick, courteous, and helpful as we asked about dishes that were not spicy, to those that were highly so (wife vs husband!). Had apps and three entrees. All agreed all were excellent (especially butter chicken and meshi [?] chicken, both non-spicy). Atmosphere is pretty basic, but restaurant is clean and obviously popular with the local Indian crowd - always a good sign!  I felt the menu offered many items not typically seen in Indian restaurants, which was nice. Lots of vegetarian dishes also. Highly recommended; we'll be back soon. (PS - they have lunch buffet every day, which we haven't tried, but do feel the price is quite high, compared to other Indian lunch buffets around the city).

I heard a lot about this place and drove about 40 miles to check out their biryani. It was pretty good and the veggie appetizers were pretty good as well. The service could have been a lot better, but the food more than made up for it. Went back a second time for their weekend lunch buffet and it was not worth the 40 min drive and 30 min wait. They barely had any appetizers and just biryani (veg and chicken). Definitely worth a try for the dinner ala carte but weekend lunch buffet was not worth it. Service hasn't changed much since my last visit either hence the 3 star instead of 4.

Updated:

Revisited a couple of times for dinner and the chicken biryani and paneer tikka(tandoor paneer something like that) are worth every visit. Could be upgraded to 4 star, but I will wait till they improve the service. Do stay away from the lunch buffet.

Being from India, we eat Indian food several times a week both at home and outside the house.  Persi's has a great reputation and they didnt let down on our visit. Good food for a lunch buffet overall.  The selection is not big but it was all pretty good.  My favorite was the chicken tikka masala with white rice.  The chicken biryani was also good but it was a bit on the spicy side.  Intense flavors are good but the heat was a bit overbearing.  The desserts lacked as they only had gulab jumun and fresh fruit.  It was good but I was left wanting something more.

Probably the best Indian option in South Charlotte in its price range. Frequent this place quite often - the food is clearly the highlight. Everything else is passable. Do try out the Bhindi-do-pyaza (Okra cooked with Onions), the Mushroom Pepper Salt and the garlic naan. 

The best time to go is for Dinner. Lunchtime is usually packed for the buffet - which I found wasn't really worth the price or the hype. The A la carte is way better!

The Applebee's of Indian food.  It's nothing special...but...it's not horrible.  It just is.

I've only been here for lunch and while I do get that they have to prepare for the buffet style eating of the lunch crowd, I'm still going to judge the food for what it was..."Buffet food."

The naan was nothing special and I can typically tell if I'm going to like an Indian place based on the naan alone.  What I love:  Pillowy, soft, chewy naan.  What I received: flat bread.

The rest of the food:

The chicken tikka masala (which I've been told isn't really an Indian dish...but who cares...it tastes good) was what I expected to be in a buffet tray.  It was okay...but I'm not exactly directing people here to get it.

The Aloo Gobi type dish however, was pretty tasty.  Great job Persis!

The rest of the dishes were good.  I would prefer trying this place again without the buffet style eating.

I love Indian food and Persis is convenient to get to from my office.  I'll come back and give an update.

Worst biryani ever ..ordered for a chicken biryani and got biryani rice mixed with chicken manchuria, no proper meat ..probably if  they think they can fool customers this way they should be ashamed for earning money out of this .
Biryani was tasteless  there was no salt at all very greecey . Meat was not cooked u have to improve ur quality

I have been to this restaurant  twice after reading the reviews but all of them
Are total lies  .. Once for lunch buffet and once for dinner .. Neither of them satisfied me . Buffet has very limited items and is just avg.. Dinner is the worst one I have in USA. I ordered a chicken 555 and a chicken boneless byani..  Chicken 555, I did not even touch a second piece after tasting. First one .. And have no words to say about byani..

The food is inconsistent in flavor. The naan bread had dry shaker garlic on it (YUCK) the dish I got did in no way tasted the same as the last time. The water carafe was dirty too. The service is severely lacking. I waited 45 minutes for a refill on my soda and never got one! It took 1 1/2 hours to eat dinner. I think they were doing a event along with takeout and dine in customers, they just could not handle it! Food was going to the wrong tables and other people were visibly pissed off. I'm not sure if I will go back.

Absolutely delicious and authentic! I have eaten at dozens of Indian restaurants over the years and Persis is by far the best indian food I've ever had. Some of my favorites are the chili paneer, samosas, garlic naan (soooo yummy!), chicken Tikka masala, and their beer is cold and perfect. We just left there tonight with our tummies full and I am already looking forward to the next visit!!

It was really salty food and waiting time was more than 45 minutes?. There was no customer service at all.  No water service, and they didn't bother to ask how was the food. It wasn't pleasant experience.
Rude staff!!! Checked in to give a party order,.. Got a rude reply.. Will never be back nor will recommend my friends..
Great restaurant at Ballantyne ... Great food ... Reasonable price... If you go there ask for Mohan . Great and welcoming waiter.. I really enjoyed food and service..
The food is really good, the head server is rude and the service is slow

I have heard good things about Persis but unfortunately was unable to try the food.  I was seated quickly but that was the end of human contact.  After waiting almost 15 minutes I left and went over to Blue Taj which is always excellent.  It was a Monday night and not really very busy.  I think there was just one waiter who also seemed to be handling all of the take out orders.  I plan to go back and try it again since the food has been rated so well.  I hope things are better next time.
Very tasty tandoori chicken and biryani rice.  The hot tea was refreshing.  Good prices for lunch buffet.

Tried this restaurant for the first time over the weekend. On Fri/Sat/Sun, the buffet was the only option. The food on the buffet was not very good. The Chicken Tikka Masala had no flavor, while the Chicken Biryani had plenty of flavor, it just wasn't a flavor that I liked. They had Mango Lassi drinks in glasses by the buffet, but the drink was warm, which is never good in a Mango Lassi. The 87.5 sanitation rating also threw me off.

The restaurant is in a nice spot. I was actually hoping for a more casual style Indian restaurant, since this seems to be a chain, but it's a traditional sit down restaurant. Bim (sp?), formerly of Blue Taj, was running the restaurant the day I visited.

I don't know if the dishes would suffer so much individually if ordered off the menu. I have noticed that the Chicken Tikka Masala on a buffet always seems worse than a fresh version of the dish. I just know that I was not impressed at all by the quality of what was on the buffet. I hope they do well, but I will probably not return for the buffet, and I'll definitely wait for that sanitation score to go up before I return again.

Loved the chicken tandoori and the chicken tikka masala. Butter naan of course. The service was excellent, Joseph was a star waiter, and overall an excellent dining experience. Good portions, good prices.
My favorite Indian food in Charlotte.   I've tried locations that are in South Charlotte and Uptown.   Persis is my go to location now.
Great lunch buffet.   Nice variety good flavor and fresh.  The staff is very polite too.  We enjoy our lunches here.
This Joseph who served food for us is cool .. We ordered rasa malai , but they ran out of it and he served us fresh gulab jamun  .. It was complimentary .. It was yummy !!

We have now been two times and both times, the food and service were fantastic. Naan is fresh, flavors in the food are also fresh and delicious and Joseph does a great job of recommending some items that he thinks we will enjoy. He has been spot on. 

Butter chicken, samosas, chicken tikka, methi chicken, goat dishes and the appetizer sampler are all excellent and we look forward to trying the rest!

The atmosphere is cozy and it is the type of place where you do not feel rushed. Thursdays have great deals including half priced bottles of wine and discounted dinners. Have not tried the buffet, but will be regulars for a la carte dining. Glad to have found Persis!

Worst customer service and worst food .. try some other Indian restaurants. 

If there was a zero rating, I would have given that

Food was good but the service was poor.  We waited for our order to be taken.  We ordered a glass of wine and it was forgotten.  Nobody checked to see how we e are doing.  We waited a long time for our check.  I won't go back.

This place is actually incredible.  I haven't explored Indian food much in Charlotte, but this tops everything I've had in Greenville, where I've lived the past four years.  That's a huge complement because I like the Indian food in Greenville.  Great lunch buffet and service.   Will be back for sure.

Uh oh, this one is on the struggle bus.  I didn't check Yelp, but rather, just stumbled upon it while looking around downtown Charlotte for a quick lunch.   I walked in and a man behind the counter gave me a spooky stare, which persisted the entire time I was looking at the menu/dishes (not sure what that was about).  I asked him if he had any vegetarian options (couldn't really tell from the menu), to which he replied: "you should try goat".  Nope, but how about the vegetarian biryani?  He said, oh yes, we have.   I got it and it was funky monkey, sort of like rice-a-roni with some poorly fried veggie things hidden in the luke warm center.  I was ridiculously hungry so I still ate about half of it; maybe I should have gone with the goat?

Terrible food and service. The buffet was missing at least 2-3 things at any given time. We found a used lollipop at our table when we sat down. The food is lacking and there's a weird aftertaste to everything. The sambar was good though. 

The tandoori chicken was gone for 20 minutes and they kept saying they'd bring it out in 10 minutes. We ended up forgoing it in the end. 

Save your time and money and go somewhere else.

We used to be regulars at the Ballantyne Persis. When they opened one in the university area, we were super excited. The initial few weeks were met with over flowing crowds and exceptional food and we were frequent visitors. Over the course of few months, the quality of food came down and their service deteriorated to abysmal levels. The crowds dried down too understandably. A few weeks ago on a Wednesday we dropped in at 9.10 PM (They close at 9.30 weekdays) and were very hungry. Even though several tables were empty, we were asked to wait. We waited for about 15 mins without being seated. After calling out for attention, one of the waiters informed us that they cannot seat us since they are about to close and can only serve take-out from a limited menu. I walked out in a fit of rage vowing to never go back there. This place deserved only 1 star for their customer service.

Food was excellent. Service could have been better. Didn't receive menus until after sitting down for 15 minutes. Second appetizer didn't come until after we were mid way through our main course. Having said all that, food was great enough to earn 4 stars overall. Biryani was especially good. Even Paneer Saag and Karhai paneer were perfectly cooked and spiced. We did ask for everything mild though.

Would definitely recommend this to others. Great new find!

Yesterday we went for dinner with friends and ordered chicken chettinad, goat biryani, chicken lollypop and dosa everything lacked flavor. 
Chicken lollypops were not seasoned at all but coated with cornflour (red edible color) and fried. All I could taste was the stale oil.
The biryani felt overdose of red chilli powder, meat was tough , overcooked. 
The curry was not authentic . 
Dosa was still okay. (Only thing we could eat. )

A group of us from work had lunch here today for the first time.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food.  Because it was lunch it was buffet style (I hear dinner is sit down affair so I may be back to try that).  The plates reminded me of camping, they are all tin/silver , even the cups and small dishes.  I tried just about everything and all was excellent, my favorites was the butter cheese (paneer) and also the fried cauliflower.  I was too scared to try the goat though.

The main reasons I knocked a star off was because the selection was a little bit light, both Aroma and Tulips (the two other places we frequent in the area have larger selections).  Also, the Naan was burnt but that could have just been that batch.

I will most certainly be back for another visit.

After visiting Persis Biryani in the south side...the best thing that happened for me as a foodie.....is to come to Persis Biryani on the north side.  It is the best Indian buffet I have ever had.  And yes.....I have been too too many to count.  Whether with a party of 1 or party or party of many...we are always greeted and welcomed to the restaurant by Ashwin or one of the great staff.  Timing is essential for weekend or weekday lunch.  Get there at the right time and you can get right into the buffet.  Everything is always presented so well.  From the sauces to the fruits to the biryanis....the rusam....the sambhar....the naan...the masala....the curries....everything is simply so so so good!  You have to be careful though....the food is so great...you can lose count of the number of plates you have eaten!!!  You have to save room for gulab jaman or rice pudding or the halwa!!!   All deserts to round off a perfect filling lunch buffet.  I look forward to my weekly visits either from home on the weekend...or from downtown Charlotte during the week.  Persis Biryani North has become the number one restaurant for our event celebrations....from birthdays...to showers!!!!!!   Looking forward to next visit!!!!

I was sitting here at work and kept hearing so many great things about Persis.  And finally got an opportunity to go with family and good friend.  The buffet was very good. Loved the pani puri and fruit custard.   Persis is known for great biryani.  They lived up to reputation.  Looking forward to return visit.

One of my top favorite Indian restaurants is now open within a few steps of the office at Gateway Village.  Providing some of the best biryani available in downtown.  No more ordering and waiting on the delivery van.  Stopped in today and had tea and observed the great offerings we have come to expect from Persis,  The restaurant offers great seating.  Great open area for walking through the ordering line.  Since it is not a full self service buffet I am providing the best rating,  Looking forward to the next team lunch outing this week at Persis,

I like this place but totally dissappointed the last time I ordered a biryani to-go.
I asked for spicy and they just mixed up raw green chilli paste in the biryani. It was a larger order and had to throw away most of it.

Dear Persis.. Spicy means more masala not adding raw chillies or its paste to the Biryani.

Never had Indian food before so for my first time  I was definitely blown away. This review is primarily on the lunch buffet and man was it filling. Lots of variety of veggie and meat options, tons of spice and complex flavors. Luckily I had my lady with me and she is a wizard when it comes to food knowledge and suggestions cause otherwise I would have grabbed whatever and hoped for the best. 

The service here is great. They are quick to seat you and get you fed. The man at the counter is super nice and is very appreciative of your business.

The buffet has so many options and is always fresh. I've been three times now since my first experience and every time the chicken is tender and flavorful, the garlic naan is great, and the dishes are warm and constantly refilled throughout the day. Appetizers, salad, plenty of entrees, and even a dessert option. One Saturday a few weeks ago we visited for the dinner buffet and man they had some killer cantaloupe juice. Yum city! This is my new favorite restaurant if I'm ever in the university are and I'm thankful for my overwhelming great experience I've had here. I'm a huge fan of Indian food now, especially the tasty variety Persis has to offer. This is a must visit place!

I love Indian food and been here a few times before. 1st time was great and i kept returning to capture that great taste again. This time not so much. Arrived at 11:30am for the buffet lunch to find the chili crispy chicken was cold and mushy. The other chicken dishes were only luke warm.  

I immediately let the owner know. He quickly removed the very full pan of chicken. He returned 5 minutes later with another pan with just a little bit in there. I assumed he just wanted to get some fresh fried chilli chicken out asap. No! Same chicken!


I go to pay at the register and question him about it and I told him not is only morally,  ethically  and inconsiderate of his customers, but I believe it's a health code violation. He said it's fine to reheat because it was cooked once already! I can't believe this is how this guy runs his restaurant.

Be prepared to eat reheated food if you come here. Absolutely disgusting! I truly believe because my first visit was so good and all other visits mediocre that they have been recycling this food for the next day or so. 

I will never eat here again!  The 5 star below mine is an employee who works there! Now this guy is posting bogus reviews.

Unexpectedly, this is one of the best Indian Restaurants in Charlotte. The lunch buffet has been consistently good. The chicken tikka masala is really tasty, especially when drenched over the plain basmati rice. Every time that I have been back, there seems to be at least one Chef Specialty dish. On my last visit is was a Himalayan Spiced Fried Chicken. Little tasty chunks of chicken that really satisfied. The Sambar (indian soup) was really tasty as well. Pleasant staff that can sometimes be inattentive when the restaurant is very busy. But I've only been during busy buffet hours. The Bollywood TV shows that are generally on can be a little loud at times.
If you like Indian food, this is definitely worth trying. Great food at a very reasonable price.

One of the worst. I know Charlotte lacks good quality and standard Indian restaurants but still there are few better than this. Agree with another review about server being pushy. Worst malai kofta ever tried. Only thing that was better was gobi manchurian. Service is poor. Bland food.

Great Indian food, absolutely lousy service.  Best I've had in Charlotte, and most dishes are on par with the Indian food that I grew up eating in Central NJ.  Don't go during lunch - that's when most Indian places have their bland, americanized options out.  Their Indian dishes (especially when ordered Medium to Hot) are authentic.

That being said, the service has been horrendous every time I've been there.  This last time, we were seated by the hostess fairly quickly, and within 2 minutes the waiter came over asking if we were ready.  We said no, so he came back about 5 minutes later.  We went with a Biryani (Chicken 65 Biryani), and the waiter's recommendation for a special when we said we wanted goat.  Ordered Naan, but the waiter was extremely pushy trying to upsell other breads, as well.  Once ordered, it took just over 30 minutes to get the food out - 2 dishes & naan.  And since we ordered around 7PM, the place was practically empty (but filled up around 8PM) so we should have only been behind 2 other tables of 2.  The food was dropped off by another waiter - the naan was cold, but nobody came by to check on us during the entire meal.  Trying to flag someone down at the end for the bill and a to-go box took a few minutes, and after requesting the bill, the waiter forgot about us.  Had to wait another 5 minutes to flag down another waiter (who acted shocked that we flagged him down when he wasn't working our table) to ask him for the bill and to-go box we had already asked for.

Extremely similar service to previous experiences - slow to get food out, no check-ins from waiters (can't order more naan if we wanted!), slow to get the bill, slow once we gave them the credit card.

On a lesser-reviewed note, they've recently had lousy health inspection scores - their 10/6 inspection was an 83, and 10/20 was an 86.  You'd think that after an abysmal score, they'd rebound a bit more (in July they scored a 94.5).  I'm trying to get my stomach ready for traveling to India, though, so I looked at this as a twisted positive...

Overall, great food, but there is no sense of urgency or customer service among most of the staff, perhaps with the hostess as the exception.  Maybe I'll order take-out in the future to get the food without having to deal with the lackadaisical attitude of the staff & lots of unnecessary waiting.

Unethical place. Ordered shrimp biriyani for take out and they mixed chicken with it and my wife doesn't eat chicken. And they have mixed it before also. When I called them about it they acted innocent. Cheats. Out of 3 times, they screwed up the spice level two times. Being honest is the first rule to run a restaurant, and these people are not

I've had a few disappointments recently at Persis, but overall the food is still my favorite Indian in the University area. 

if you are looking for something spicy, try the Gobi 65 appetizer. It's harsh and spicy but amazing! Unfortunately, the last time the Gobi was not crispy even though we ordered it extra extra crispy. When brought to the server's attention, he argued at first until we asked him to take it back to the kitchen. He returned shortly thereafter only to tell us that the kitchen said it was perfectly done. Since I've been to Persis and ordered this exact dish many times and it's always been crispy, I'm going to overlook it. But it was not a pleasant experience and made me reluctant to go back for a while. To be fair, the waiter later told us that the main chef was off that night, so I assume the Gobi got tossed in the sauce and left to get soggy for a few minutes. Timing is key on this dish. 

We've also recently tried the Chicken Tikka appetizer, and it was great.  It's served on a cast iron skillet with cabbage, onions and extra sauce in the bottom so no bite is without flavor.
Amazing food.  Love this place.  My girlfriend didn't tell me about this place for the longest time!!
Great hidden gem!! Food is fresh and delicious!!! They're not afraid to get things spicy. Service could be better. I go at least once a week though!
The chicken Tikka masala is a little too runny. The waiters do not ask you for your drink and you have to ask them. They do give you water. The tandoori chicken is okay too.

We've ordered from here through Door Dash twice. The food was very high quality. We got the Chicken Tikki Masala, Shrimp Vindaloo, Garlic Naan and an appetizer. The food was spicy but we LOVE spicy food! The food was also hot when it arrived. I highly recommend!

Just back from their lunch buffet and it was the worst I have ever had at Persis. The food was cold and did not look appealing at all. The taste was not very impressive either. No much variety to experiment.

Usually a fan of their biryani, I did not like it much today. The 'Meethe ka Tukra' was horrible.

Hope it was just one of those bad days and they pull up their socks soon.

We have been to Persis several times and have never been disappointed. The wait staff is very helpful and attentive, particularly Joseph. Our favorite is Methi Chicken, borders on being addictive! Our last visit included the Tandoori Lamb appetizer, marinated in yogurt and spices, so tasty and tender, arrives at your table on a sizzling platter with grilled onions, peppers....YUM!! Also tried the Hayward 5000 beer, mild flavor, very good. They are also very helpful concerning menu selections regarding wheat allergy. Looking forward to our next meal at Persis!

My husband and I used to come here a lot and the food was amazing. Sometime within the last year they changed their chef and the food has significantly gone down hill! At one point their waiter was making food! Their food is inconsistently terrible-- sometimes it is really greasy, sometimes unbearably salty, and sometimes it is just not at all what you ordered! You never know what you are going to get, but it is never good. After giving this restaurant a second, third, and fourth chance to redeem themselves, we stopped coming all together. We will never go back! Poor move on Persis' part for firing their top-notch chef last year. If you want good Indian food, try Passage to India on University City Blvd instead. The only positive thing I can say about Persis is that we enjoyed their Indian music videos that played on their TV.
Service needs to improve. Food is generally good, however. If you can look past the hit-or-miss service, then you'll like this place. Otherwise, you're gambling for a good experience :)

Just back from their busy saturday lunch buffet.
Food was exceptional ! 

From appetizers to curries to deserts, everything was on point, neatly refilled and hot and spicy.
We were quickly seated and offered drinks and the used plates were removed time to time from the table.

Though it was quite busy and noisy , it didnt stop us from enjoying the food because it was that good.

I couldnt stop admiring how delicious DUM KA LAMB was, i had to refill the curry 2-3 times. Every non veg item was perfection.

You could tell i am writing this review from the food coma this place gave me.
Good buffet. Pleasant customer service.  Was crowded which is a good sign. I would definitely add this to my list of places to eat.

I love this place sooo much. I've been trying to try as many Indian restaurants in Charlotte as possible but I feel none ever surpass Persis Biryani Grill in quality. Everything is always incredibly fresh and cooked perfectly. My all-time favorite meal wherever I go is goat curry, but I always feel Persis does it best (don't tell my uncle who's won awards for his recipe).

We were in the mood for byriani so we decided to give this place a shot. When we got there we realized we had been there several years ago and was not impressed
As long as we were there we decided to give them another shot
We ordered , staring off with vegetable pakora. " sorry we don't have that " really??
They ran out of veggies at 6:15 on a Saturday night
We the placed our order for chicken byriani and lamb saag
Both pretty tasty
Because it was pretty chilly there we asked for hot tea
Sorry , no hot tea. Chex us too busy
Wait service slow
Gotta find another place

We went to Persis for the first time last night and the food was amazing. I had the Navrathan Korma and would 100% get it again. My husband was also really pleased with his dish. We have only eaten Indian previously at higher end restaurants--Blue Taj and Copper and we both thought the food was just as good at Persis as the more upscale spots.

Updated:

Buffet is only good when staff is organized and not flustered with how busy it may get or what food needs to be replaced. A lot of times I've found myself waiting for food and very little is brought out to replace what is out. Sometimes the staff doesn't notice right away when something is gone so be sure to help them out and let them know. I recommend the chicken tikka masala with white rice and naan bread. They have a good variety.

Dinner time is a better experience since you get more one on one interaction. Larger groups are treated even better and may receive a complimentary dish as an appetizer. Same if you are a regular. They pay attention and take note of what you like. If you have someone struggling to take the heat they may also bring out a complimentary drink to help. It is a very nice and tasty place.

Just tried again....food has AGAIN gotten worse.  What is worse than a place with bad food is one where the food consistently changes!!! Today the tamarind was greenish, bland and didn't have the same flavor every tamarind i have ever had has.  

Naan wasn't out for most of my 30 minutes there either ...this is an indian buffett...it wasnt even busy, where the hell is the naan?!?!!?!?

We finally caught up with Denise and Chad the other night for socializing outside of a Yelp event. :-)  After stopping into to Duckworth's for a bevvy, we went to Persis for dinner. (Good call Chad!!) I must admit, I was a little unsure of how we would like it because the reviews on Yelp were a bit mixed.  However, I was impressed with our overall experience.  Even though the restaurant was pretty busy when we arrived, we were seated immediately.  

Our service started out a little slow because our waiter was brand-new and did not know the menu.  We had questions, and he had to go get the manager (or owner) to help us.  I did not catch the name of the  manager/owner but he was so helpful and patient with our questions.  He also told us detailed information about some of the dishes and explained some of the differences about the various regional cooking styles & history about how some of the dishes were developed. 

Everyone was hungry, so we decided to start with a couple of appetizers. We also ordered off the menu for our entrees - which was good because I am not a big fan of buffets. 

Samosa - Crispy pastry turnover, filled with potatoes, peas, spices and herbs Served with chutney-  5 stars.  This was one of the most delicious samosas I have eaten.  The inside was flavorful and the crispy pastry was perfectly cooked.  

Gobi 65 - Cauliflower marinated in Corn flour batter & spices, deep fried and tossed with yogurt and spices - 5 stars. Wow, I would have never ordered this if it had not been for the recommendation of the manager/owner.   But it was really delicious!

Naan -  4.5 stars.  The naan was very fresh and tasty. 

Chicken Tikka Masala - Cubes of chicken roasted in a tandoor clay oven cooked with mildly spiced tomato gravy and served with basmati rice -  3.5 stars.  While the dish was flavorful, it was not the very best Chicken Tikka Masala I have ever eaten.  I got a 3 out of 6 on the spicy scale and thought the spiciness was just about right. 

Chicken Khorma - Pieces of chicken cooked in mildly spiced cream sauce with fresh cilantro (coriander) - 4.5 stars. 

Unfortunately, we didn't save room for dessert on this visit but they have some good selections on the menu.

I thought the prices were very reasonable ($67 for 4 entrees, 2 appetizers, 2 orders of Naan, one coke, and one glass of Prosecco)  and the quality of the food was good.  I noticed that the majority of the other patrons during our visit were Indian, which I thought was a good sign.

Got the non-veg plate -- includes one curry, rice, and naan. The chicken was good and plentiful (unlike some other local Indian places), but not very tender, so I think they grill it separately and just toss it in the sauce. Sauce was spicy! In a good way. Rice was fluffy. Naan was tasty but soggy. Portion size was good. Price was a wee bit too high, and selection varies by day.

The best Indian restaurant in charlotte by far. The food is authentic and flavorful. The service is very attentive and helpful in explaining everything. You have got to try this place if you appreciate the flavors of India.

Somedays I'm just craving Indian food and I don't want the buffet. I found Persis when I was in such a mood while in South Charlotte. Yes, they offer the buffet and it seems that's their bread butter for the numerous office employees in the area. However do not ignore their menu.

After a hiccup when I arrived after they had closed after lunch, I came in already knowing what I wanted. As it was late lunch, I was starving so I started with samosas and fresh mango juice. it's such a pleasure to have fresh juice available in the middle of the day. The samosas were fresh made and light, the breading not too heavy as can happen. As my main course came a wheat roti flat bread with Daal Tadaka, a yellow lentil tempered with onion, tomato, and red chili served a generous bowl of basmati rice. I was very full and had enough left over to take home for dinner.

Service was very attentive, a little on the hovering side, but I appreciate that more than the opposite. Parking is easy in the strip mall and it a multi state chain. They are sticklers for hours, I've arrived 5 minutes late for their lunch service to find the door locked and been turned away when I arrived 10 minutes early before dinner service started but the door was open.
This place is amazing delicious and the staff are wonderful. Highly recommending coming in during lunch for the buffet

They have now opened a takeout restaurant in Uptown Latta Arcade- Although the food isn't that bad. Its a terrible value. You get about a 1.5 cups of white rice and 1 cup of Veg/Non-Veg  combination for 8.99. I know they are paying to be in this location however, $9.00 for lunch and very little, is not worth it.  They need to re-think this.

I visited Persis for the first time this weekend.  I waited to go on Sunday because the Sunday Buffet is normally the biggest and the best way to get a taste of the majority of their dishes at one time...HOWEVER, this buffet totally lacked in variety. It was not even as many options as an average lunch buffet but costs a WHOPPING $13.99!!!!!

The service was good and the food was okay, but definitely not a good value at all. I doubt I will make that drive again.

I thought the food was lovely and I frequent indian restaurants all the time. We got paneer 65 for app, loved the crunchy outer layer. For the meal, we got the okra which was quite good but had a lot of diced onion. Also ordered the paneer markhani and it was great although it could have had a bit more paneer in it. Garlic naan scrumptious but have you ever had bad naan? Price overall was reasonable. We left fat and happy. Yum yum.

This is the best Indian food I've had. Just go here, eat something, and be satisfied. The heat in the lamb vindaloo is the kind that doesn't last too long, but it is very intense and flavorful. It came out of the kitchen super hot, and I learned from the last time I ate the dish that the absolute worst thing you can do when eating spicy food is burn your tongue on it while it's hot. So I took my own advice this time, took it slow, get a mild appetizer and some naan to enjoy between the bites, and had a fantastic time. The hostess offered me a cocktail special called an Indian Sunrise that had mango puree and spiced rum and some chili powder in it (I think). It was awesome. I'm so happy I live near this place!

Visited today for the lunch buffet!  We have been to several of the other Indian buffets, and really enjoyed this one! Great variety of Southern and Northern Indian food, loved the lentil stew and the carrot pudding for dessert was Devine.  There was a full house, so I think it's catching on.

I had the lunch buffet on my first visit to the restaurant.  The food was excellent and diverse.  The food was very fresh, properly cooked, and never dried out or left out for too long.  The goat biryani was the best goat that I have ever had!  There were plenty of Indian customers dining at the restaurant which indicates a high degree of confidence in the food served at Persis.
The wait staff was very attentive, polite, and professional.  
The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere festive yet pleasant.
The buffet was very reasonably priced with a diverse selection of entrees.  The waitstaff recommended the Sunday buffet as being even larger than the weekly lunch buffet.
Summary: the restaurant is highly recommended, and I will be a regular customer (including bringing my coworkers and friends).

I'm a fan of Persis.  It's tucked away in a shopping center on the corner of Ballantyne Commons and Johnston. When it comes to Indian food, I don't have a huge repertoire of dishes under my belt, but what I've had, I've loved. 

It can get very busy on Sunday for brunch but if you can snag a table - it's well worth it - especially if you want to try a bit of everything. But just a tip - you may need to dodge several people in order to get your food and it can feel a bit chaotic with the number of people trying to fill their plates.  

My hubby and I have done dinner here mid-week and it's quite enjoyable.  The service is very attentive and the servers are willing to answer any questions you have about their dishes. And for spicy food lovers - this place is for you! I usually go with level 3 but I think I can go a bit higher next time.  Their naan is really good  - chewy and crispy at the same time - and the chicken tikka masala is awesome - I could drink the sauce!   I look forward to trying something new next time.

This was basically bad fast food. The sides were not proportional to the large amount of rice you receive. Pretty bland. Naan seems like its been reheated.

Had wished it would be better, but I was not impressed.

Oh my goodness!  I couldn't even get in the door of this place as people were piled up in there so that already tells you the food is legit......yep, a serious line to get in the restaurant and another line for the buffet and it's all worth it.....they serve many of the regular Indian favorites on the buffet plus mango pudding:-)  My new Indian crush......

Disappointing. The butter chicken had too much garam masala in it, which seems like a common problem in many Indian restaurants in the US. The butter naan was overdone. The service was good though - the waiters were very softspoken and polite. The decor was nice. The place was full on a Saturday night.

I have been to this place twice, once for dinner where food and service was good.

Second time, for lunch-buffet.Limited choice when compared to other Indian restaurants in Charlotte . Food was very spicy. Tandoori Chicken was not properly cooked could feel the raw flavors of paprika.
The service was horrible.. We waited half an hour for the check.. asked the waitress thrice. Finally ended up paying at the counter. 
 
Not worth of $14.

Persis is one of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte. When you think about Biriyani Persis is the first place that comes to mind. I strongly recommend this place as the no 1 choice for whomever is looking for delicious South Indian food. Not only the taste but also their service which makes you visit Persis again and again.

This is the greatest Indian buffet place anywhere around Charlotte.  The food is always fresh and soooooooooo delicious.  Grabbing the lunch buffet on Sunday will set the tone for the rest of your day being  awesome.

The food is really good but the what is holding there rating from a 5 star is the service.  I got the Chicken Tikka Masala with onion naan.  I asked the Chicken tikka to be made with a spice level of 4 out of 5.  The food was really good and rich in flavor.  The Naan was soft and really warm.  I enjoy going to Persis but the service is the only thing holding them back.  All the food I have had there is really good.  An appetizer recommendation is Chilli Panner.
Food here is always amazing. This is the only Indian restaurant that I will come to. Korma Chicken and Methi Chicken are my favorites!!

This is a great restaurant! There is always something new and the food is always on point! I come to this restaurant at least once a week because it is that good! See for your self, you will not be disappointed!
Phone number does not work.  Food is not bad for the area.

I have visited this place twice both on Thursday only for dinner.first we have ordered chicken biryani and chicken 65 they both tasted awesome.next visit we tried dosa actually Thursday night is special for dosa.biryani was good.indians will like the taste.we have ordered fresh lemon soda also but that is not good.overall both the visits was awesome.we loved the lamb dosa very much.

First timer at this restaurant - but like Indian food for the spice. Waiter was very helpful with the menu pointing out food that was both spicy and not so spicy. The food was excellent - look forward to my next dinner date at this restaurant with my wife.

Food wasn't so fresh and I found it very bland. And the waiter was so super annoying!! He kept asking me questions and tried to flirt with me. Asking me question like ' am I single ?' Why am I single?' Then he started complimenting and saying stuff like 'you're so beautiful' ' when I saw you I was like wow' 
I found it very inappropriate and very uncomfortable. Never going back for sure.

The food was incredibly good and I couldn't finish my entre there was so much! The service was just as amazing as the food was! We poured the last of the water from our pitcher at our table and within 1 minute they brought a full one! We were checked on every few minutes and even the owner checked to see if everything was good a couple of times! I can't wait to go back and would do so just for the service let alone the incredible food!
Best indian food I have eaten in a very long time. Came here twice in 3 days. Afternoon buffet covers it all. Must try if you are in neighborhood.
As good as it gets - spicy, flavorful, a huge variety.  The chicken curry was exceptional, and the lunch buffet allows you to get more of this exceptional.  Looking forward to going back.

I wish I would have seen the Health Score before eating!!! So the food was okay, but nothing to write home about. I could have just left it at that, however the Health Score that they had was UNACCEPTABLE for any place that deals with the public!! Below the score was the Serve Safe Diploma that showed that they passed a course on food safety. To get a 72 which is a C do you have any idea how MANY POINTS you ave to loose??? That is Dangerous to  the public!!! I can't see why they are allowed to stay open during this time. NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!

Literally the best indian buffet ever. So clean, so neat, and so so good. Everything is delicious and service is fast. I have only been to the lunch buffet and have recommended it to everyone i come across.  its gets very busy on a Friday for lunch so that might be a downfall to have to actually wait in line for the yumminess.
Awesome Indian cuisine. Loved the biryani

Stopped in for a quick lunch during the work day. Their buffet has a great variety, is fresh with options for apps, entrees and dessert.

Everything was clean and well labeled.

It's a great deal at $12 for all you can eat. The wait staff was super attentive (almost too much so) but hate to knock a place for that.

Love the large selection of sauces with the small containers.

We discovered this gem on a rainy night looking for a restaurant.  Small, intimate and VERY Indian.

Our problem was a lack of understanding about the menu offerings.  Lots of dosas and curries and what we ordered was excellent, but we could not understand the ethnic servers.  Even when the owner came over, we never really understood the dishes.

They do offer a buffet lunch, but we have not been there for it and don't know if signage is there to explain what is being offered.

Too bad, as it was packed with Indians with my wife and I the only gringos there.  You just know it is good.

We are trying to get an Indian couple to join us for dinner there so we can get educated.

If you are looking for authentic...this is the place.

Yuk yum yum! Ate here for dinner with the fam one night: ordered chili paneer, samosas, shrimp appetizer, goat biryani and chicken chettinad:
-Unless you are lord Vishnu himself, do not order spice levels 5 or 6. Ive eaten some spice in my time, but the tears were really flowing on the 6. Would definitely recommend a 4 spice level as perfection.
-Items took around 20 minutes to come out, as there were a couple of tables, but everything was excellently flavored and well presented. Highly recommend the Chili paneer, which comes out steaming!
-Chicken chettinad was creamy and well spiced and the biryani was deliciously fluffy, but I would recommend getting chicken instead of goat because the goat was unusually stringy. 
-Nice ambience for an indian restaurant, they have plenty of booths and an extensive wine and drinks list. Would make a good indian restaurant for a date. 
Fantastic northern charlotte eatery!
I went today for lunch buffet. Worst experience ever.  Seemed like food they were serving was old.  I actually got sick after eating there

Everything is fantastic. The only problem is when there is too much crowd, the staff is not able to maintain the quality of the food. Esp on Friday and sat nights. Chicken biryani rocks! It is advisable sometimes to order for a take out .. service is slow during crowded days. 

Desserts is not a speciality out here.

Best Indian spot in charlotte. First off you can usually tell if it's authentic or not based on the percentage of Indian people in the restaurant and this place is always at around 95%. This isn't watered down and Americanized. Food is priced accordingly and I've never left dissatisfied.

My husband and I had lunch here today and I have to say we were both blown away by how hot, fresh and delicious everything was. 
That's after having been to both Tulips and Passage to India; neither one of them comes close to Persis. The restaurant is bright, open and very welcoming, with additional seating outside. 
My favorite was the chicken 65 which was  not very spicy but they have lots of spices that you can add to it and things to cool off your food too it's too spicy. The goat was perfectly cooked and the chicken curry is really spicy but not too spicy; again you can heat up or cool off your food as you wish. 
We were the only people that did not appear to be of Indian heritage in the restaurant so that tells me you're onto something. If you haven't gone you're really missing out. 
I have a new job in the area and they deliver on Tuesday Wednesdays and Thursdays so I plan on telling everybody at work about it. You owe it to yourself to try this restaurant. It costs 10.99 during the week and 11.99 on the weekend. It's well worth the price and we'll definitely be back.

Stay away from this restaurant at any cost!!
I just came back from Persis 30 min back and was forced to write this review because of the horrible experience we had there.
My parents are here with us from India and so we decided to have some Indian food & so visited Persis.

We ordered masala papad, 3 dosas,2 naan and a navratna curry.They completely forgot about our order and made us wait for almost more than an hour without serving anything.Remember, it is a weekday and there was hardly any crowd!

When I went and reminded them that there were folks after us who came and got their food the only explanation that was given was : "we have a shortage of cooks today".
We were only given masala papad which was cold and they also charged us for the papad,pathetic.No sorry, nothing for the terrible service and wasting our time!
It seems the restaurant is run by a bunch of mindless souls (do notice a guy who has a beard and a pony and is at the reception and has an American accent - extremely arrogant & worst of the lot) who have no sense of what customer service is all about !!
This has worst Indian food for ever , staff and chef keep changing ,  very bad  service as well. Don't go here, This recommendation is coming by an Indian , who leaves only for good food only!

The quality of this food is amazing. But this is the third time I have been there past 11:30 am and there is no food.  I waited around 15 minutes then walked to Nirvana, which I don't recommend either.  The servers are apologetic and explain that they bring the food in from their other restaurant and they run late sometimes. Yeah, but why don't you bring it in earlier if you see that you can't get it here at the agreed upon time? If you say you'll be open at 11:30 am, please be dependable. Many of us only have a small window of time to get lunch.  Makes me wonder if the owners care at all.  :(

Good, but not great.

I came here based on the recommendation of the King, the guy with the most check-ins here.

What they get right: variety - they have a nice variety here and they do serve biryani on the buffet which many places don't bother with.  They also had the obligatory chicken curry or butter chicken etc., the thing your non-adventurous fellow diners can eat.

I enjoyed the way you can bring your food back to the table, reminds me of a dabbas carrier.  I really like being able to put my raita in a little bowl and the edge of my plate.  They have a variety of different sizes of metal bowls/tins depending on what you want.

What was missing - tandoori, I like the tandoori chicken but I really enjoy the onions and green peppers that go with it.  Flavor - some of the items weren't up to what I had wanted.

WARNING: This place is inconsistent.  I agree with what I read in the reviews about things being a positive experience along with those having a negative experience.  I don't know why but each time I go here the experience differs widely.

My favorite Indian dishes, other than biryan, have been absent.  I love chana masala and all forms of korma.  I haven't seen rogan josh here yet.  I go here because it is close to where I live, but I am trying other places trying to find my sweet spot.

Good enough most the time but not so good that I don't yearn for something better.
I think I found my Friday night place to hang out. Very nice attendants and very fresh tasty food. They have a very nice cocktail menu as well with kool play of words was interesting.

Although I have not tried too many and so cannot exclude them, this is certainly one of my favorite Indian restaurant in the Highland Creek/ Concord Mills area. Another similar option is by WT Harris/ Tryon shopping center (likely by the same owners). Great variety of options with excellent ingredients for the money.
Still the worst Indian food in Charlotte.  I keep going back hoping it is back to its old glory again but it's so bad I'll wait a few years this time.  Cold bland food, horrible selection.

This place is excellent.   We have had dinner here half a dozen times in the past few months and every experience is consistent.  The staff is conscious of spice tolerance and will ask you your preferred heat rating from 1-5. 



The wait staff is a bit slow but I will chalk that up to them wanting us to enjoy a dining experience.

Since neither my friend nor I knew about Biryani, we decided to gamble on a new place and WON! BIG! ! !

We walked in a saw Bhim (former Manager of the Blue Taj) and we were confident this place would be good!  They have only been opened about one month and Chefs are still arriving, they have done almost no advertising and at 1:35 Tuesday afternoon we walk in to a more than three quarters full Restaurant!  Most of the Patrons were Indian!

We had Chicken Tikka Masala, Manchurian Chicken (an Indo-Chinese dish) Chicken Biryani, Salad and Naan Bread (Salad and Bread with Raita included with Lunch)... The Salad and Dressing were very good and the entrees were Exceptional!

Since Persis is on a corner you have perfect access to the Outdoor Alley Dinning (shared with the neighbors and Persis staff will serve you there)!  This is a cool Dinning area!
