We had a heated discussion for 5 minutes.When my turn came to pay,this guy charged me close to $13.90 something and rest of my folks $11.00(The Ballantyne corporate discount).I still have the receipts and can post them here. 

How's this fair??? Is it because of me saying that their food quality downgraded over the last couple of months and they must need to IMPROVE.....


I'm definitely not going there again and I will ask my colleagues too to avoid this place.

Hands down this is the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to, and I've been to dozens. The flavors are complex and very fresh.  I don't know why there are two star reviews of the service because each time we go the waitstaff is fantastic.

I was expecting that my craving for the good chicken biryani will be fulfilled at this place. I heard many great things about this place, especially about the biryanis. As the name of the establishment says, it has to be good because it's in their name. :-)

I was totally and utterly disappointed that night. May be they are good with biryanis. May be they are awesome with their biryanis. May be what I heard about them, before I went there it's true. But not on that night.

I went solo as always, and I sat at the table. Without going through the whole menu, I ordered chicken biryani. I can see an expression on the face of the person waiting the tables. He repeated what I said by adding one word. I asked for chicken biryani. He said, "just" chicken biryani?. I confirmed, yes - just chicken biryani. He recommended me to have medium spicy as I can't handle hot spicy based on the "Indian spice Scale". I don't want to take any chances. Most often the hot spicy is just uneatable. So I went with medium spicy.

Apparently, someone from a small group on the other table ordered chicken biryani. So I got an assurance in my mind that their chicken biryanis must good here, as someone else has also ordered chicken biryani.

I could not taste any flavor, that kick, that something which would make me call it even a decent chicken biryani. It was a disappointment. I was very hungry by 7:30pm, and by the time I got my food I was at the peak. So I ate faster than usual with the hope that I will get the good part or good feeling after few bites. I could not feel it even after working on half of the portion.

The guy from the small group who had ordered chicken biryani, called the waiter and informed him that the chicken biryani is flavorless. The fun part of going solo is, I can listen and eves-drop at other peoples conversation, sometimes without any intention as people can be loud in the public places, you know. ;-) That customer's buddy, asked him to speak with the waiter in Telugu, which he did. Waiter replied in Telugu. I understand Telugu and can speak Telugu. Why someone needs to have conversation in Telugue specifically? Interesting! The waiter took the chicken biryani plate and came back probably with the flavorful chicken biryani. I was thinking if I should inform the waiter the same about my chicken biryani which was more than half eaten by this time. 

I felt robbed that the only thing I came for and the only thing I ordered, was not anywhere close to what I wanted, what I expected, what I heard about. But I was hungry, and ate the whole biryani. 

While paying the cheque, I tried to put politely to the waiter that the chicken biryani did not feel like it. There is "just" that thing is missing, you know, that makes it chicken biryani. He said we make fresh and something else that I don't remember as I was absorbed in my thoughts about whether I should give this place another try next time whenever it is. He asked me if I speak Telugu. I don't know why this is a relevant question in this discussion. I said yes without thinking much as I do speak and understand Telugu.

Anyways, the bottom-line is that, it wasn't the good dinner. I could fill my belly but not my soul. I walked out of there unfulfilled. Keep in mind we Indians are all about food. 

So, will I be at this place next time?
Just had the lunch buffet and it was awesome. This should be among the top places you would go for authentic Indian food in this country.

Delicious! My husband, who is not food-adventurous, loved his dinner as did I. The app platter was wonderful even the fairly hot peppers. He had butter chicken and loved it. We got an order of okra which was delicious and the waiter suggested getting lamb with methi sauce.....yum! The wait staff was very helpful, very personable and made great suggestions.  Will definitely be back!  By the way, my husband has said "great choice" three times while I have been writing this!

I had REALLY great  expectations from this place as my friend took me to this place saying they have the best biryani in town...I was pretty much disappointed with the Chicken 65 Biryani I had (Boneless chicken biryani)..We ordered Butter Chicken and Kadhai Paneer too, which were okay to say the least. The only good thing about the food was the Lachha Parantha..Do give it a try. For the money paid, I was not happy with the food at all.
I've only ever ordered my food to go, but I've never been disappointed. I appreciate that they actually give you enough rice. Their naan is delicious!

I've eaten at Persis three or four times. As a huge lover of Indian food, I get really upset when I feel it's been done incorrectly. (You may be thinking, "Who is he to judge?" I've had enough Indian food to know the good from the bad). Persis doesn't make me do cartwheels but also doesn't make me want to go dashing to the nearest trash receptacle either. I usually order the chana masala or the eggplant; both are pretty good. This is a solid Indian restaurant that I'll probably continue going to.

My only gripe is the speed of service. I can definitely say the concept of a "sense of urgency" is all but lost here. I've ordered take-out on several occasions and its taken upwards of 30-35 minutes each time, but even then sometimes it's not ready by the time I arrive. Is this enough to deter me from returning? No. I like Persis and will continue to patronize it, but geez, please light a fire under your chefs.
Delicious authentic Indian food!!! Marsala tea is included in the bar and they have the best raspberry Gullas I've ever had!

This is the best Indian restaurant in Charlotte. The taste is very good for almost all vegetarian items. I always prefer Chilli Paneer to start with. The Veg Biriyani or Naan with Paneer Butter Masala is good for main course.
Worst food ever. Visited here for a lunch buffet on a Saturday and overall the food quality was disappointing. Give it a miss and save your tummy a bad experience.
love this place the food was awesome nice and spicy. Great selection and friendly staff. well definitely go back again for the lunch  buffet

My husband and I live in Columbia, SC and we drive 1  1/2 hours to eat this amazing food!!!  We have only eaten there during the lunch buffet so we can't comment on "off the menu" or dinner (I am sure both are great).  

My husband eats everything from the buffet and LOVES all of it.  

All I do is grab 2 vadas and a big bowl of Pongal and I am set.  I am a South Indian who grew up in Houston eating Pongal every Sunday and I think the Pongal is just as good as homemade.
This is my favorite Indian restaurant. Very good service and the food is wonderful. I've been here a few times and have enjoyed the experience each time. I highly recommend Persis!

So really this review is a 2.5, cuz I thought the food was way good. Buuuuuuut...the service was really not my favorite. Waiter seemed nice enough, but he was very foreign when it came to customer service. Most small box asian restaurants I don't expect the service to be amazing, but I was highly appalled at how poor it was here.

*first, the waiter grabbed a high chair for my toddler and he wiggled it a ton before asking me if it was ok. Ummm, dude. If it shakes, do you think it's safe to put a kid in it? He didn't even offer to get a different one. 

*second, his accent was super thick. That wasn't really the problem, but it def made it hard to order. Mostly it was that that he was way pushy about ordering appetizers for our kids, and he gave us like 30 secs btwn figuring out how to order and asking us about drinks. It was a bit irritating. 

*once we ordered, it was mass confusion. We got a couple things ordered, but he kept interjecting suggestions (I think) or just commenting. I don't know. We originally only wanted 3 entrees, one for the kids to share and 1 each for my hubs and I. But somehow we ended up with 4 dishes, 3 rices, 2 orders of naan--even though I thought he said to us to only order 1 (which I thought was what he was bringing). It was confusing, and the waiter was unapologetic about the confusion when I said he misunderstood me or I him. He basically kept saying "you ordered it. You ordered it." Errr...no dude. I didn't. I said I wanted his suggestion for a tandoori dish after I said I wanted a tandoori chicken--not that I wanted both a tandoori chicken and a 2nd dish. Lesson learned: have the guy repeat your order back.

Also, that wiggly unsafe high chair was just put back in the pile. He didn't even wipe it down after my toddler smeared goober hands all over it. Cmon!

Again, food was very good. But order it to go, cuz the service sucks. Or go with the notion that you see your ticket b4 it goes thru. Cuz what I thought was gonna be a $30 meal with our gift certificate ended up being $70!!! Dumb! We won't be back, cuz I just didn't like the stink eye I got from the waiter on the way out. Dude! We still paid for all that extra food, and you got a tip you ass.

We just moved to Charlotte may 26th and discovered there are 9 Indian restaurants within 5 miles of our new home. Over the next several weeks we plan to visit all 9. Saturday, Persis was the 2nd we tried with our son and his fianc. For appetizers we had samosas and pepper fried goat. The Samosas were fried a little too much and the goat was ok but too many bones and very spicy. For the main course we had lamb curry, Navraton Korma, paneer saag and chicken tikka. The spice level was moderate except the saag was up a notch and the tikka down one. The dishes were good but the korma relied on squash and tofu as the bulk of the vegetables and was more soupy than we are used to eating. I enjoyed the saag but it too was more creamy than we are used to. While not among the best Indian restaurants we have tried over the years, Persis will deserve another visit in the future.

UPDATE:  I used Persis Biryani Indian Grill for catering my HOA's couples dinner.  We had set the catering for 60 people.  The short version is: food was great, and people really enjoyed it.

The long version: They did some things at a 5 and two things at 2, overall a 4 rating.

What they did well, food was cooked well and just as good as if you had ordered it as a single entree.  This matters because catering larger quantities sometimes leads to quality problems.  They provided take home containers for the leftovers and didn't hurry us out and throw food away.  This was very thoughtful and much appreciated.  They were helpful and professional the entire time they were with us and during our event.  The price was very reasonable.  It is easy to spend a great deal of money and have a great experience (also possible to spend a lot and have a poor experience), it is something even better to spend less and have an equally great experience.  They labeled the dishes, not exactly but with varying degrees of specificity, this was a nice touch.

What they did poorly, they showed up late.  The restaurant is within 4 minutes of our venue.  They showed up about 15 minutes late.  The distance matters because that means they didn't leave until about 10 minutes after they should have arrived.  The guests were already there.  This is also partially my fault since I left them no tolerance window, if I had asked them to arrive with a 30 minute window then they would have been setup just in time for when the guests arrive.  Still showing up later than requested and agreed upon is a poor performance.  The spice levels, I had been very specific the level of spice I wanted in some dishes.  I wanted to have some of the chicken dishes at baby mild, like water, as a food option for people who can't tolerate spicy food.  One of the baby mild dishes came out at near medium spice level.  Some of the dishes were considerably spicier but I had specified those.  This is only a minor negative because the most popular dishes were the spicier dishes.  I also respect that using natural spices isn't the same as using a chemical in a factory, they can't predict the exact potency of each chili.  That being said some of the safe dishes cam across as a bit too spicy.

Let me repeat: the food was delicious.  Very few people had problems with the spiciness of the food, and at the end people swarmed like locusts to take the leftovers home.

The owner is very nice.  Very nice.  I like the guy, I want to be his personal friend.  All the staff were very friendly.  I can't emphasize enough how likable all the people who work here are.  It is really a great pleasure to plan and cater an event with someone who is very friendly.  Not only is he friendly, he is intelligent.  He gives great insight and recommendations.  His food estimates as to volume were spot on.  I will definitely use this catering in the future.  I think if you give this a chance you will thank me, of the many restaurants I contacted this was the most responsive one with the clearest explanations and answers.


Original review:
Some variety for a very good price.

I mainly like this place because my brother jumps at any chance to get lunch with me at this place.  The company makes it worthwhile.

They have less vegetables in the tandoori chicken than I would like (I really like the onions and peppers).

The shining star for this place is that they change up the buffet.  They keep staples like butter chicken on there as well as biryani (it is the Biryani Indian Grill), but they rotate in some very exotic items each time I visit.

I actually don't care for the biryani that much, even though it should be the signature dish.

You don't see much goat or lamb, these are items I am looking for.  Weekdays it is always chicken.  You should really head out here on the weekends and pay the extra $2 for the meats.

Addendum: the chana masala is excellent, the korma, rogan josh, and malabar are all superstars.  I would argue that in Charlotte they have the best mango lassi have ever tasted.  The flavor is potent but it isn't overly sweet.  They have a very robust flavored raita, it is my absolute favorite.  It may not be a great fit for everyone, but the last time I had it there were plenty of vegetables in it and a strong bite to it giving it a very full flavor.

This is my new favorite spot for Indian food. I just had Shrimp Briyani  and Paneer makhani. The food was delicious. Also, the manager Emily and her staff are great and very hospital. I will be coming back here frequently with friends and family.
The owner helps make the experience great, it is a buffet after all.  The food is good, price is fair, and it's packed with Indian customers, so must be good.

We are looking for good Indian in the Concord area. We tried this place, which is next door to a vegetarian Indian restaurant. We had to ask to get service because they were focused on buffet. The servers were polite but dressed like warehouse workers. We had iddly, which was dry and bland; butter naan, which was salty; rice, also.m bland; butter chicken at spice level three out of six, which was pretty spicy IMO, but acceptable; and goat biryani at spice level four of six, which was so hot that my wife, who has eaten biryani all her life, couldn't tolerate it. It left her nose running. For spice level six, better call the fire department, I guess. On the positive side, the rasmalai was decent, the food was served on attractive stainless steel plates, and actually music from India was very playing. In summary, better than nothing, but not what we had hoped for.

Had the lunch buffet, which was $42 for three people. About half the patrons were Indian, which I see as a good sign. There was a good variety on the buffet. The curries were a bit spicy for my taste, but not by much. Overall, good and a nice variety.

To be honest, this was one of the worst dining experience I've ever had. I refuse to go to this restaurant ever again. Really cheap looking interior. Water served lukewarm with no ice even on request. 
The waiter argued with us for asking to not serve the appetizer first but to bring it out with the entrees. There were three babies crying super loud because it was around closing time and the owner  refused to find a baby sitter and brought one year olds to a restaurant. It makes me unhappy that a place that had decent food had to ruin the nuance for its customers and I wish they improve on all of these points. Besides that, the flavors were good for the food but even with only 5 tables in the entire restaurant, the food came out barely warm. I really was hoping that this place would've been a great experience but I was entirely let down and walked out 26 dollars less in my pocket for just shy of a 6 ounce portion of food

I feel like as Indian food goes, Ballantyne is the best place in Charlotte to find it. I also think that Persis biriyani Indian Grill is an excellent choice for Indian cuisine whether you are an Indian 'Desi' or a local Charlottean. The only reason I give Persis a four star rating is that the food is sometimes too oily and sometimes it can take much longer than quoted for an online order. Make no mistake, I will continue to frequent this fine establishment. Overall, the food is great!

This restaurant is awesome. The first thing I noticed was that my party was the only non south Asians, which I took to be a good sign.  Despite the place being packed, the staff was very friendly and eager to help.  Everything was very clean, and the decor was modern but classy.  I was especially a fan of the stainless steel plates and drink ware. The lunch buffet was some of the best Indian food I've had in a long time. The flavors were varied and everything was very fresh.  My personal favorite was the watermelon smoothie, which was an excellent and refreshing palate cleanser.  While the price was not the cheapest at around $13 for the buffet, the exquisite dining experience was worth it, and I will definitely visit again.

On the hunt for some Indian food away from our usual stomping grounds, we decided to hit up Persis, out Ballantyne way. Turns out it was a good choice - but only after we had a stumbling block (perhaps even a rather large stumbling block) in the form of the first waiter. The problem was he had no idea what he was serving - may not have even realized that he was working in an Indian restaurant.

Luckily the manager/owner/someone off the street rapidly walked over and began explaining the history of Indian food - at least Persis Indian food, or something that we could believe as such - and wham! the night was saved, just like that.

Would the food itself have been as good without this save? Probably. But it was made a whole lot better with it, especially such items as the cauliflower appetizer that we may never have spotted, and the personal touch that we had thereafter. Definitely made it just a wee bit better, so even though it wasn't bad before, grab this guy if you can.

We had been to Persis in Ballantyne before and absolutely loved it, but this was our first time trying this location. It was awesome.

Firstly, playing Bollywood songs on the TV gets me. Every time. I can't stop singing those songs and it makes me enjoy my food so much more. They also had the India-Australia cricket match playing on another TV which my boyfriend, who is learning to understand cricket, loved watching.

We ordered the chilli paneer appetizer, which was yummy. Chilli chicken tends to be spicy, so make sure to adjust your spice levels accordingly. The flavors melded well, and the paneer had absorbed the spices well. For entree we ordered the goat biryani (anyone surprised?) It was amazing, obviously. If you have never had goat before, you should definitely try it here for the first time. The biryani came with raita (chopped salad in thin yogurt) and a thick curry.

The manager / captain was very nice. He was very attentive, as were the servers, and they all kept asking if everything was good, but not in the intrusive manner. We will definitely be back soon. I'm already drooling at the thought of their biryani.

I am sorry I gave these guys 5 stars in my last review. These guys RUINED my wedding reception!
The fact that I loved their food so much made me sign them up to cater at our wedding reception in October. I had talked to the manager way back in April, decide the menu, talked about the pricing etc. Then in September I called them to make sure we were on track with everything and the manager I had talked to was nowhere to be seen and there was a "temporary" manager in his place. He had no idea about any of the things I had talked about with the previous guy, they had kept no records of it, which was very stressful. At that point, we should have found some other place, but we didn't. We went about the whole thing over again, and had to negotiate the price because his price was much higher than what we were quoted earlier (thank god I had it all in my diary). We walked out of the restaurant at least knowing that we would get good food served at the wedding. Then two days before the wedding I called to make sure everything was in place, and the manager had changed AGAIN! This new guy, Reddy, had no idea what I was talking about and told me they couldn't cater on such short notice! Having stressed out enough, I raised some voice and the owner called me and he knew what he was talking about, and I am so thankful he did.
However, at the wedding, these guys brought all the food and NO utensils to serve the food with! Also, they promised us three servers but only two were on the venue at any given time. Also, in spite of telling them to make the Veg Biryani mild, they made it spicy. I am so mad, I will never even think of eating at this, or any other location again, and will NEVER recommend their catering to anyone. 
If you want your event to go smooth, do not even think of having these guys cater. Very unprofessional and mismanaged!
I have only been here for buffet. Staff is friendly. Lots of options on the buffet. Tandoori chicken and tikka masala chicken is amazing!!! So flavorful and spicy and the chicken is so tender!

This food is really great.  We had the Gobi Manchuian and the Chicken Korma.  You can order your food on a spice scale of 1 to 6 and we chose 3.  It was perfect.  The Gobi Manchurian reminded me of buffalo shrimp in both taste and texture.  The restaurant was very clean and actually served the food in stainless steel plates and cups.  The service was good.  The only thing I did not like was the Lassi drink which is yogurt based.  I will definately be coming back here.

Spectacular buffet lunch.   I don;t always indulge in Indian food, but this place may change my opinion. While many place serve stale indian food, I think this place makes em fresh and in small batches to keep the food great.

Tandoori chicken is superb. You can tell it just came out of the tandoor.  Crispy and juicy. Lot of flavorful spices.  The biryani is awesome. Fluffy, light, super aromatic.  

Lots of servers and they keep an eye on the food at all times so they never run out. The naan is served in small batches too, to keep em from getting soggy.  

Come ready to eat cos you just can stop!!
By far the best indian food AND service I have EVER had. Amazing. I think our server's name was Joseph. Freaking amazing.

Worst experience. They kept me waiting for 45 minutes and they were busy in preparing other orders. Atleast they didn't even tell us that our order is going to be late or would take some more time. They served the appetizer but it was also very bad. We didn't like the service and we just left from there and they did not even apologize for the bad service. 

There is no option to give 0 stars in Yelp otherwise I would have given 0 star for this.

Every time we have been there, the food has tasted different. Only the first time it was fresh and tasty. The last two times I ordered chicken 65 and hyderabadi goat biryani from here and each time the chicken tasted very old and had a smell to it and the biryani rice was not cook well and the goat meat had a smell too. Needless to say, I couldn't finish and everything ended up in the garbage both times. I should have learned my lesson after the first bad experience but I wanted to give them another chance since I did have good food here a year ago!
The methi chicken and onion kulcha were delicious! The chicken in the chicken biryani was soft and fresh! The chicken 65 was also excellent.

We had a fantastic meal at Persis. Our server, Joseph, did an excellent job of helping us choose our dishes. We had some in the group that were gluten free. This was not a problem and we ended up with a varied selection of foods. I highly recommend this restaurant.
I enjoy the quick service and Indian fix within walking distance to work. Nothing spectacular but solid. Not much more to say about it. Works when you need it.
This is awesome indian food. I would eat here every day if my wife would let me. I want to be buried here when I die. The food is that good!!

This is my favorite Indian Restaurant. Everything I have eaten here has been delicious! I normally order take-out, but today I decided to go in and give it a try. 

They have a lunch buffet, and I saw what was on the menu by checking out their Facebook beforehand. I think this is a great idea! 

This place was packed! And that can only mean one thing to me -the food is amazing.

The host who seated me was very friendly. After I got my food, I asked if I could have some onions. I saw someone complained about getting extra onions (and I love onions) so I tested it out. They brought me a good amount. 

My food was so delicious! I had Tindoora, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Biryani, and Naan. And to end an already great meal - They have Falooda! 

I highly recommend this place to everyone! It was $15, which I think is a great price to all the great food!

We visited Persis late one evening when there was a nice briskness to the air.  We thought it'd be a perfect time to warm up with some of our favorite food!  Upon entering, we were immediately seated and handed expansive menus full of incredible looking dishes.  Being vegetarians, we often seek out Indian food and Persis doesn't disappoint in their offerings.  

A few experiences stood out that night.  Hang with me.  To start, I wasn't comfortable drinking out of the metal glasses, so I asked for glass and the waiter immediately accommodated my request without question.  Graceful and polite. 

Then, the strangeness began.  My husband had decided on biryani at spice level four. The waiter (who we later found out was the owner) tried to convince him that level four was 1. Too spicy for 'people who usually come here that aren't Indian' and 2. Asked a few times if we'd ever had biryani..that it was a very traditional dish.  Once we finally convinced him that both the dish and the spice level were adequate, he insisted upon bringing a sample of biryani so that my husband could try it before he bought it.  The funny part is, the sample was almost as large as a full order.  The spice level was perfect, the sample biryani was delicious, and the main entre of biryani was a normal portion. They didn't take from it because we agreed to a sample.  

I ordered chana masala with no spice. I found out later they call this  'baby mild' :-). However there must've been some confusion in the kitchen, because the owner told us that there was already an order of chana masala at level four that was confused with my baby mild.  They brought out a new order of Chana masala (still spicy) that looked suspiciously like my original AND offered a complementary order of any other entre of my choosing.  The owner strongly suggested the paneer with fenugreek leaves. It was delicious and perfectly seasoned.  

All in all, our meal was excellent with a couple of speed bumps along the way. But as they say, it isn't the mistakes but how you recover from them that matters.  We will visit again and again. Delicious food, super value, portions  - wow.  Keep up the hard work Persis!

Whaaaaaaaaat!! How have I not known about this place?!?! Other cities have way better options on desi food and I've always been generally disappointed in the options in and around Charlotte but this place has won me over. We tried several dishes and all were flavorful, warm, and fresh. I didn't get the "this just came out of a can/box/whatever" feel from this place and I love that! The restaurant wasn't super busy around 730 on a Monday night but they did have a steady stream of customers (desi people eat late....LOL). Anyway, the servers were very attentive and quickly and efficiently brought and removed items to and from the table. Cannot wait to go back and try more dishes!

We go to Persis Biryani once a week on average. The food is that good! I'm giving this one star tonight however. I recommend perhaps not going here on a Tuesday night. The food while delicious as usual came to us via perhaps the worst service we experienced since Persis opened in the University City area. Usually the restaurant is slammed and the table service is amazing...tonight they were slow and both the table service and friendliness of the staff earned a D minus.

Food was good. Service was nonexistent. Our first time was on a Friday night. There were only 4 other tables being waited on in the entire restaurant. It literally took over 5 minutes for a waitress to come over after we had been seated. She simply said "What do you want?" No smile. No greeting. No introduction. It went down from there. She was very abrupt with our 6 yr old who only wanted to say hey. We ordered two entrees and only got one small bowl of rice. It took about 8 minutes to wave our waitress down to ask for another bowl. She was no where to be found in a restaurant that only has one big section. After several minutes we waved a different waited down to request our rice. We never saw that 2nd bowl. It took over 10 minutes and another waitress for us to finally get our check. Still took another 10 minutes before they returned with our card and receipt so we could leave. Not sure if I will ever go back but if so it will definitely be carry out.

I have been to several Indian lunch buffets around town and I just found my new favorite!  Food was fantastic, nice variety on the buffet and great, attentive staff.  May sound odd, but I really liked the  plate ware - variety of metal plates, bowls, ramekins, etc to use.  I will be back soon.
Great lunch buffet - awesome way to try different indian dishes! Love the paneer saagwala!!

For the first time I'm giving 5 star rating to an Indian restaurant. We drove all the way from Greenville to Charlotte to eat some good Indian food and I'm glad we been to this place where the buffet was really amazing.
Lots of items to eat from chat, appetizers, South Indian dishes, biryani and desserts. Each and every item was really delicious. I would definite suggest this place if you're in Charlotte. 
I'm going to this place again this coming weekend for sure
Great lunch buffet options in a clean environment with lots of natural lighting and friendly service.

I really enjoy coming to Persis. I frequent this place at least twice a month for the lunch buffet. The food is always delicious and the staff always makes sure my needs are accommodated. The guys who work there are consistently polite and professional which is why Persis became one of my favorite places to eat. As soon as I finish eating I start thinking about the next time I want to come back and who else I can tell about the wonderful food!

This place is okay. Better than other Indian food places I've tried in the area for sure. It is a typical buffet style serving, with a variety to choose from. We noticed that most of the patrons were of Indian descent, which is a good sign since they would most likely know quality Indian food over someone born in the US (just saying). Like most Indian places, there is no description of the items in the buffet (like if it contained yogurt or curry, etc), just a sign of what was there. The buffet seemed a little awkwardly laid out, with desserts in the beginning as well as the end. Tandoori chicken was a little touch and disappointing, but the chicken masala was very good by contrast. Prices are cheap. I would come back. Slightly above average, certainly not bad at all other than what I already mentioned.

We found Persis after my husband passed by the place on his way home from the University area.  We've been back more than a dozen times already, and are always willing to drive the distance for their delicious food.  

We've tried many of their appetizers, but our favorite is the paneer tikka.  Even if you don't like Indian cheese (or have never tried it), you MUST get this appetizer at least once.  The paneer is cut into large cubes, baked in a tandoor oven with a delicious sauce, and served with sizzling onions, peppers, and cabbage.  It takes a little longer to prepare, so order it first!

On our first visit, I was initially disappointed with the few shrimp dishes on the menu.  But when I asked if there were any other options, the server offered me shrimp korma.  I'm a huge fan of korma, and jumped at this.  He also suggested switching my husband's dish from lamb vindaloo to methi.  We'd never had methi, so he jumped at trying something new. 

Both dishes are consistently phenomenal.  Their korma sauce is not your standard creamy sauce with raisins and nuts.  This is more of a mix between a korma and a tikka masala sauce, and it's my all-time favorite variation.  The shrimp are also nicely sized and perfectly cooked.  

Their methi is similar in color to a korma (wit just a bit richer color), and it has a more complex flavor.  The lamb is always cooked perfectly.  

We love our bread, and Persis's naan, roti and paratha are marvelous.  We always order extra so we'll have some with our leftovers.  And there always are leftovers, which usually taste even better than even the first time (if you can believe it)!

The dining room and atmosphere complement the food.   They now play soft, relaxing music, which has improved our dining experience tremendously! 

Persis is our go-to spot for Indian food.  If you go, ask for the shrimp korma and lamb methi, even if they are not on the menu!

Food Rating: 5
Service: 1

This place has very good food but the service is terrible. The lunch buffet is never ready when they open at 11:30. You have to sit and wait 10 to 15 minutes for them to put everything out. If you are going to open at 11:30, be ready at 11:30! If you order any drink other than water you are lucky to get it before you are finished with your meal.
Its not indian,its totally south indian.biriyani has curry leaves in to it.most of the dishes are not made up properly and buffet charge also higher....waste of money

when we first went to persis it had a great owner nuveen, he treat the staff well paid them far wagers and the rewarded him by taking control of his business while he was in India The is still basiccal the same works just with equal percebtage

Butter chicken was good. Chicken Tikka was tough (never had it like that before so disappointed).  Atmosphere very nice. Service was strange.  I had to put my hand up everytime we needed something as the server stood at the front of the restaurant.

On their better days, the food at Persis is moderate at best. It was never spectacular, nor is it inedible. You'd say 'Hmmm not bad'. But on their bad days, you'd get little surprises in your food. One time I found a strand of hair. The second time it was a Stapler pin! And 2 days ago, they really stepped up their game... I found a thumbtack/pushpin (whatever you want to call it) in their Chicken Biryani.

Every time I complained, they'd just shake their head in a fake apologetic manner and carry on. They didn't offer to replace or reimburse. They offered me a free biryani on my next visit, which I am dead sure I do not want!  Who knows what! Honestly, I am still not sure why I kept going back... my bad! 

I guess I have learnt my lesson. We are never going back there and I'll make sure my friends don't too. 

Like they say... third time's the charm!

You'll be hard pressed to find better Indian Cuisine in the Queen City.  The chicken tikka is incredible.  The beer selection isn't amazing but they offer microbrews at very affordable prices ($3.50).  You know it's a good sign when the restaurant is nearly full and you're the only one who isn't from Indian decent.  Love it!

I called in a take out order for lunch one weekday.  I ordered the paneer butter masala...#5 spicy and buttered naan.  

The man on the phone was a little pushy.  He asked me about three times if I was sure I wanted #5 spicy and about 4 times asked if I knew which location I had called.  Yes...I'm sure on both.

The order was ready in 15 min.  It was really spicy and really delicious.  I loved it.  The spice amount is pretty dangerous if your not used to it, so choose wisely.  The sauce was creamy and tasty.  The naan was a little more crisp than I like it, but overall satisfactory.  I will definitely try this place and location again.

Let me start by saying this is some of the best Indian food I've had. I set my standards low because coming from Atlanta I didn't expect much. However, the service and food at dinner was fantastic. Our waiter was polite and helpful at recommending dishes. He checked on us regularly and we never had to wait very long. We got chicken tikka masala and another dish that I can't remember the name of (it is green and has spinach and cottage cheese). Both were delicious, especially when paired with the garlic naan bread. I'd definitely recommend this place. I can't wait to go back.

Came here w a large group on a Friday night. The evening started off smoothly enough - our waiter was friendly and quick to bring waters for everyone. The meal took a turn for the worse at that point. The waiter disappeared for 45 mins while we waited to place our order. When he got around to us he kept ducking out while we ordered to take care of other patrons. The food took nearly another 40 mins to arrive, so do not come here if you are starving when you sit down as I was. 

The food - to preface this I have eaten Persis catered food at many an event and have usually enjoyed it. However the waiter was not clear on spice levels so you have been warned - don't order above a mild (#2) unless you want to be crying in pain during your meal! I am of south Asian descent and I ordered medium spice goat biryani. It was nearly inedible.  Not to mention they had cooked the goat in way too many cloves. Chili paneer app was delicious, as was gobi manchurian, although gobi was again quite spicy. Fellow companions enjoyed their more mildly spiced lamb vindaloo. 

Now reaching the end of this epic meal, our waiter disappeared once again and the bill took 30+ mins to arrive after two companions chased him down twice. Once we got our bills we were told the credit card machine was broken and the waiter had to hand write (!) my number down to charge me later. So yet another warning - bring cash. 

My thoughts - if you have a craving for biryani or manchurian style (Indian Chinese) food, place a takeout order. But I cannot recommend sitting down for a meal.

Food - 4 stars
Everything Else - 0 stars

This might be the best Indian food I've had in Charlotte.  Unfortunately it was also one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had.

The portions were weak The music was terrible and loud.  And our server was super awkward. He could barely speak English, hovered around creepily, and put his hands all over the silverware and plates. Literally the last guy in the world that should be a server (I've worked at a lot of restaurants). Ok, I get that you hired your relatives or whatever... but why can't your food runners at least speak English?
 
But when it comes down to it, I put a lot more stock in food than service, and I'll def be back... I'm just picking up to go.
Great lunch buffet. Good variety and very tasty. The front manager was also very gracious. Definitely coming back next time I am in Charlotte.

I saw Persis when I was leaving the Jojang upstairs and added it to my list of places to try. My first experience was takeout chicken Tikka Masala. It is a tomato based bisque with spices, peppers, and chicken that tickle the taste buds in the most delightful way. It isn't spicy, despite its red color. I tried it again and there weren't as many peppers included. Met up with a buddy for lunch so I could try the buffet and get a taste of as many dishes as possible.

The thing about Indian food is that *to me* it is not visually appealing. You have to be willing to close your eyes and eat. They have a green bean based dish that was good, but very salty. You'll want to eat this wish white rice to tolerate the saltiness. The chicken curry was okay, but not overwhelmed with the chicken flavor. The chicken tikka masala was still great. They biryani (rice) was good and flavorful. I got the kind that was colorful. What was not good was the rice yogurt. It was bland and I expected it to be a dessert, but that was not the case. 

Because it was a buffet, service was very hands off. They will seat you and that's it. You're on your own. No one to ask questions nearby.  Nevertheless, everyone is nice and I recommend you visit Persis. Great $10 lunch buffet.

Very good. When for Saturday buffet and everything was hot and delicious. The only reason Persis doesn' t get 5 stars is because they started burning incense in the restaurant which they didn't need because the smell of the food was good and incense can over power everything , even your taste buds.
It's been downhill for the past year or so, new management or new chef, either way not worth your time or your money: far better Indian food places than this

This place has the best indian food I have ever had. Very authentic and the flavors make you feel like you are in Mumbai. The only problem is the service is very slow. Don't come here if you are on a schedule. The service is polite just very slow. I had the butter chicken. It was amazing.

My favorite place for Indian-- buffet or not! The naan is great, the chicken tikka masala is yummy. My boyfriend and I go here anytime we are in the area (usually about once a month). We usually get take out, but we occasionally have time for the buffet! He really likes flavorful food, so this is a winner for both of us!

This place is amazing!! Their food is authentic and delicious. I had the butter chicken and I had to order another one to go so I could keep eating it the next day. The rice was delicious and so was the naan. My only complaint was that the waiter seemed a little annoyed with us because we could not pronounce the names of the dishes and we had a hard time understanding him but that was understandable. It was a wonderful place and I will certainly be back

Ah, the long missing Biryani place for Charlotte. Charlotte had its share of Indian restaurants, few as they might be - but none of them had a good biryani, a good gobi manchurian, or a good (fresh) samosa. There were places with good north indian curries (mostly because of the amount of cream they used), but they either did not have the biryani, or if they did, they made it in the most horrible way possible.

This is a brand new restaurant - its barely been 3 weeks since it has started (and I've already been there 10 times - that says something, doesn't it?), and while they are still experiencing growing pains, and having trouble dealing with the crowd that comes in, curious about the new place, the quality of the food, as well as the taste, is amazing. I can flat out say that these guys make the best gobi manchurian I've had in the US (and I've tried it at MANY places). I've already said a lot about the biryani, but let me add one more thing - it takes you back home. Its very tasty, doesn't have the raw masala we come to expect in Indian restaurants in the US, and its very well done.

The curries they have are great as well. Due to the limited menu they have currently during the opening weeks, I haven't been able to try all the varieties, but of what I've tried, all of it is super tasty, not extremely creamy, and feels good in the stomach (if you've ever had indigestion issues after eating in some of these Indian restaurants, you know what I mean). 

The staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and very eager to help. Right now, Bhim (the manager) is probably the only one who is good at what he is doing, but as I said, its a new place, and it will improve over time. The chef is also very friendly, and is always open to any input you might have.

Overall, relative to the other places around Charlotte, this easily gets 5 stars. I will probably go here again and again, until I get completely tired of the place, or a doctor tells me that it is very unhealthy to eat out every other day. :)

I am writing this review on behalf of my boss. He was traveling through Charlotte for business and was staying at the Aloft which does not have an onside restaurant. After some research I came across Persis and pointed him in their direction. Mind you that I work for an extremely picky eater so my fingers were crossed that he would like this place and that the reviews were accurate. HE LOVED IT! He said it was some of the best Indian food he has had and got 4 entrees! If my boss loved it, I guarantee ANYONE who likes Indian food will too!

Service was 5 stars, but food-wise, the best thing was the mango lassis and the naan. We ordered our dishes medium, and what we received was MUCH spicier than medium. I took one bite of my dish and knew I couldn't eat anymore - and I enjoy Sriracha to give some indication for how hot this was. My husband ate about half of his, because his spice tolerance is much higher than mine, but even he said it was really more of a hot than a medium. Within a few hours though, he knew there was a problem. Suffice to say something, probably the chicken, was bad. We ended up having to throw out more than half of our leftovers when we realized it. We won't be back...

Man, I love this place. I go to the lunch buffet here all the time. Typically, I am not a fan of buffets, dry room temp food...bleh...but Indian food seems to hold up well on a buffet. 
   This is THE best of the best when it comes to Indian buffets. In case you haven't picked up on it yet, this review is purely on the lunch buffet since I have never ordered off of the regular menu. And who can decide anyways when faced with a full indian food menu?! Who doesn't want a veggie dish AND a meat dish...and daal and an app AND dessert .... or is it just me?? So I find myself way more decisive when going to the buffet. "I'LL HAVE SOME OF IT ALL THANKS!" Easy.
   So having been to my fair share of Indian buffets in my life including Aroma (which is good but the selection is quite limited) and the late great Namaste, I have found my home at Persis. I can't say enough good things...great selections of vegetarian options (usually end up being my fav thing on the buffet and great for when you get stuck having to eat with a vegetarian), the food is hot and the chicken is always tender (even though I usually go to the tail end of the buffet time), tastes great and has a nice level of spice ( I can see some items being too spicy for some but if you can't handle spice it is usually wise to steer clear of the dishes with chilis floating around in there), water is delivered instantly and the plates are cleared promptly after you are done with them, and the folks that work there are kind and very enthusiastic about you trying their country's cuisine. I am not usually much of a dessert fan, call me a savory gal if you will, but I do have a sweet spot ( see what I did there?!) for Indian desserts and Persis always has a great one or 2 or 3 on the buffet to wrap up the meal because of course you need more food in your belly after 3 rounds of the buffet!
  I only have a few constructive tips for how they could make the best even better. Fresh naan delivered to your table upon request (as they do at Aroma), throw a mutton dish on the buffet, and ALWAYS have the mushroom matar on there.

This is one of the popular indian restaurants in the Charlotte area. I had visited this place almost close to 15 times since I Iiked their food quality.But down the line unfortunately their service had gone pathetic. The manger and the servers started behaving rude and they never responded to our requests. After all service is equally important as the quality of the food and hopefully their management realizes this pretty soon!

It is sooo good. Period! Fresh food, flavorful, and always hot.  Lamb roganjosh superb does not disappoint.  Chicken masala absolutely wonderful.  Warning if you can't handle spice then always go level 1.  I got level 2 on my masala and my mouth was on fire, but it was so good.  

We love this place, but tonight was even better.
Always great food here, whether it's biriyani or any other curries. Try their Goat biriyani!

Horrible service. Seemed like they did not want my business. The waiter didn't want to answer questions at all. Even had to wait to pay the bill. I figured they would be fast to get the money because food and service are clearly not the priority.

Love this place! Authentic Indian cuisine and great staff. We love Indian food so have eaten at many Indian restaurants in Charlotte and this one is the best by far.  Their tandoori chicken is to die for. Can't wait to go back again and again.

It's my second time in this reastaurent this one is best in Charlotte I enjoy the food.services people also very nice it's really very natural and authentic Indian reastaurent I liked it and I recommend to people to visit this place.

My husband loves Indian food. It is a cuisine he got accustomed to during his business trips to Dubai. we were very excited when we found this restaurant in the Balantyne area.
The menu looked very promising , It has a wide variety of items. we ordered, the assorted vegetable platter for appetizer and for entre , the choice was the Shrimp Tandoori and the shrimp Biryani. Surprisingly, we got the Shrimp Tandoori ( entre ) before the appetizer. In a way that was good because it was the only plate we enjoyed. The rest was a disaster, The appetizer was mainly a combination Jalapeno peppers and onions dipped in dough and fried.  It lacked any taste  so we barely touched any of it. 
The Shrimp Biryani is described on the menu as ( unique Shrimp Beryani cooked in dum style garden fresh vegetables with basmati rice) . Yet, when we got it , It was mainly rice topped with onions. I don't know what happened to the vegetables mentioned on the menu. On top of that, it was so spicy, we couldn't eat it. We made sure to tell the waiter when we placed the order that we like everything mild and not spicy. That is for the food. As far as the service, the waiter did is best but he seemed overwhelmed.
After all, it was a bad experience and a waste of money. We definitely will  not go back.

I work in the area and this is one of my favorite lunch spots. I probably eat here 2-3 times a week. The main reason I love this place is the variety in dishes they serve for their lunch buffet. Most other places I've tried they serve a limited number of dishes and chicken is the primary meat. But here, they got chicken, goat, fish, etc. And they seem to put out a couple new items a day so it doesn't get old or boring. They also do brunch buffets on Sundays too. Great place for healthy and satisfying lunch if your into Indian food.

Grabbed lunch here at the Asian Festival this year. They ran out of the vegetarian dishes I wanted, along with the rice and naan. They still tried charging me full price, I bartered and a dollar was taken off. The chana masala was good, a little bit spicier than expected, but really liked the fresh tomato and cilantro on top that I mixed throughout the dish to really accentuate the flavors. Also had some gobi, also good.

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, as the food was mediocre.. nothing significant about the food, customer service or price stood out as being significant.
Still very good. I just love the variety in flavors and superb quality and freshness of every dish served on the buffet. What a deal!

I always order take out from this place during lunch time. The portion is great and taste is better! One lunch take out has always been enough to feed my family of four. I am very pleased. Highly recommended!

Loved these guys my husband and I have tried them for both lunch and dinner.

Lunch experience: VERY BUSY! Your sometimes lucky to get a table if you arrive a bit after noon. We found one table that was right in front of the Buffett, so it was quite noisy. The food was great and appeared fresh and tasted great. I think it was considered pretty expensive for a lunch buffet however.  I remember us spending about 3ish dollars for the two of us and then two week later, it the price was reduced to 11 dollars. It was really pricy for what it was for the first experience. 

We have come back several more times and we have had a wonderful dinner there. I am a big fan of their chicken masala and butter chicken and the chicken chettinad.

The waiter had checked on us thought our meal and was always full of the water jugs that they use for drinks. It appeared that they had a fully stocked bar with a collection of beer also.

I highly recommend this place for a great dinner.

Great authentic South Indian food!

Last time I went I ordered Masala Dosa and Lamb Vindalu and try we're both pretty good.

Service is extremely helpful and they really make it easy for those not so familiar with the cuisine, order any of their delicious dishes

A very authentic style Indian restaurant off of Mallard Creek Church road, Persis delivered high quality, delicious food at a reasonable price - a good value.  The food itself was spicier than many of the other Indian places in town, and certainly tasted a bit more authentic than their competitor's fare as well.  

The day I went, I tried several dishes including a chili, vegetarian curry of sorts (the name was all in Indian, so I'm not really sure what it was called), Chicken Tika Masala, and a Goat curry.  

The chili curry was great, set your hair on fire, delicious.  Really a star.  The Tika Masala was pretty decent as well, and actually had a bit of spice in it, which is quite different than some of the other places around town that serve the same dish.  I also really enjoyed the Goat curry, although it may be a bit more "extreme" than some casual Indian foodies might like seeing as how much of the goat meat came "bone-in" style.  I wish they didn't crisp the naan so much, but really... it was a minor imperfection in the grander scheme.  

Service was fine, but then again it was a buffet, so I'd rather not venture a critique on that.  Overall the experience was great however.  Decent food, decent location with easy access to the main road, in, out, stuffed so full you pass out at your 2pm meeting - a winner!

I'm upping my opinion of this place.  Management, it would appear, has listened to the masses and (at the moment) they're trying to open this location on-time or before 11:30.  Novel concept, and I welcome the change.  I'm glad to see they are taking their customers more seriously, and I've added this spot back into my work-lunch rotation.  Nice job, now if only they could figure out the soggy naan conundrum....

Came here for dinner over the weekend. We arrived close to closing time. We were greeted and seated immediately and provided bottled water. We were starving so put in our order shortly after arrival. I ordered the chicken korma and my husband order the chicken tikka masala. The waitress asked us how spicy we wanted the food and we asked for a medium level of spiciness. The waitress confirmed that it would be "Indian medium spicy." We love spicy food,  so that was good to hear. 

The food arrived shortly after and wow was it good- it was great!!  The spice level was just exactly what we expected.  The flavor as on point and it was just delicious.  I couldn't finish my entire dish and so I took the left over chicken korma to go. I ate it 2 days later and it was still really good!  

Definitely recommend!

Very worst briyani I never had..we ordered goat briyani to go order... Goat piece like a hard rock eating feeling... Old goat they're pushing out for those who order for to go... If you're interested to taste real Indian briyani don't go there..

We are a regular at this restaurant and never been disappointed. 
The staff is good and food is excellent for the Indian palette. Joseph is the one we take advise from on specialities on the menu.

This was really the best India buffet lunches I have experienced.  I am not a great big fan of Indian cuisine but when I can see and read what I am about to consume, it's a lot easier.  With numerous selections, I made two trips to the buffet for lunch and I never do that!  I ate way more than I should have.  The best items were chicken and vegetable biryani, butter chicken (delicious), papad, plantains, and the fresh fruit.  Everything I had was delicious because I selected them.  My only issue was that mango pudding was not on the buffet this particular day.  Otherwise, this was a great meal and really look forward to returning.  Oh, and service was great and I ran into a former co-worker!

My favorite Indian food place so far in  this area. I loved the buffet here it was good. all fresh curries and Puri bhaji.  they do have delivery but not for the lunch time; which was the only thing i felt was weird. rest everything was good.

I wasn't super impressed with this experience since Aroma just blew me away a few weeks ago. 

I ordered a Goan breeze to start, was pretty good. It was like a strong pia colada. We started off with gobi manchurian and were sadly disappointed. Gobi manchurian is supposed to have this crunchy texture. It's almost like you shouldn't be able to tell the difference between this and orange chicken which was just lacking here. 

The we ordered the malai kofta and goat pepper fry. The malai kofta had 4 small, round dumplings and the sweetness of the dish overpowered the spice. On the other hand, the goat dish was so spicy it couldn't be finished. We also ordered the chicken biriyani. It had good flavors but was also lacking in heat. 

The waiters didn't check on us once nor asked the desired spice levels of our dishes. This is experience was ok but not amazing.

Whenever we go to Fox and Hound for poker, we like to get takeout chicken biriyani (order it spicy!) from Persis since Uptown Charlotte is an Indian food desert. We called in about 30 minutes before closing and were a little hesitant to pick up since he said it would be ready in 15 minutes. But, to our surprise everything tasted perfect. Great flavor with the earthy spices and heat with the chilies. The portion size is also reasonable. I haven't been to the buffet before, but I do love my takeout biriyani, will be back for more. Cheers!
This restaurant is amazing. The staff is wonderful and the food is out of this world. You will not be disappointed!

I love the buffet here. I get to try a lot of different Indian dishes. I've had the weekday buffet for $9.99 the weekend buffet for $11.99 and the special buffet on Christmas for $14.99. The special buffet has goat, lamb, fish and chicken and unlimited mango lassi. Weekday buffets have chicken, paneer and veggies and usually tea or orange drink.

Lots of Indians eat here so that's a good sign. I like this buffet more than the others I have tried.

I come to Greenville every year to visit grandparents. This is the first time I tried this restaurant since it first opened in 2017.

Chaat papdi, chai, naan, paneer Ki sabji was delicious. 
The prices are incredible. Cool hall.
Restaurant is clean.

I definitely recommend it!

There wasn't a long line at this place during lunch on Monday. Overall the food is decent and edible, but the price is too high for what you are getting. Portion sizes are plenty.  The flavors are a little more on the bland side, save for the overuse of cardamom. The spice level is about a 2.5 out of 5. Those who do not like their Indian food very spicy would feel at home here. If you're in a hurry and over on the South Church side of town then this place would do. Otherwise, keep walking and visit Nirvana II where you'll get higher quality for the price.  

Chicken Tikka Masala was the best dish to my surprise. This chicken was a little on the dry side, but the sauce made up for it. 

I don't recall the name of the dal/lentil dish I had, but it used a green lentil.  This was more of a soup. It was very watery and quite bland.  Steer clear.

The vegetable biryani was also rather bland. It appears the rice was pre-cooked and then a biryani paste and vegetables mixed into the rice, leaving most of it white without flavor. Capsicum/bell pepper was used in the dish which I think is uncommon. The chicken biryani also looked this way. I was hoping for some good biryani as there really isn't any good places uptown.

The naan wasn't bad. A little soggy, but had good flavor.

I love Indian food!  I've dined at this place 6 times now (2x buffet, 1x take out, 3x dinner menu) and each time has been amazing.  Food has been fresh and delicious.  I can only speak for the vegetarian dishes because that's what I like, and they are comfort food.
The samosas (appetizer) are perfection!  Honestly, I can just have that as a meal and leave a happy girl.  
The Kofta dish is amazeballs ... literally!  The aloo gobi is refreshing!  Naan is soft, chewy and fresh.  
Service is warm and inviting. Complimentary thin cracker bread is served with three chutneys.  The red/onion one is my favorite.
All in all this little place is at the top of my list these days.

This is a great southern India restaurant!  The staff is very friendly and the service is outstanding.  Be sure to ask for Joseph.  He is most knowledgeable and will order for you if you wish.  I strongly recommend you eat here soon.

Came here the other day since I was really craving Indian food and was not disappointed. The butter chicken was delicious and creamy and the naan was very flavorful and the perfect texture. The rice was very flavorful and aromatic, definitely impressed. I got my food to go and the staff were all very friendly. I'll definitely have to come back as this place is only 10-15 minutes from my house. I am so glad to find a good Indian place near me! The other one I tried near University (passage to India) was just awful. I'll be back very soon to sit in and enjoy with a glass (or two!) of red wine :)

We do not live in this area of Charlotte, yet had a friend date that called for sharing a meal together. We were SO EXCITED to try Persis as we realized they offered a buffet on Saturday. Everything was amazing! We cannot wait to return!

After attending a Friday night event with friends... we used Yelp to search out something close for dinner. Indian sounded really great, and we had not tried this place yet. So glad we did! Not only was the food phenomenal, our waiter as well as the staff who came to our table to chat.. were extremely pleasant and helpful in assisting us with our likes/dislikes. This was a major plus for our experience! They do serve a buffet that at the time we came was not open. So this will be our next visit so we can try everything! Absolutely recommend!

Went there because of an expiring groupon...will be back bc it was just great.  We had the Chicken Vindaloo (Spicy in just the right way) and vegetable Korma and both were outstanding.  The waiters were nice and attentive and obscenely helpful with descriptions.  We also had the basket of assorted Naan and that was just perfect.  Very pretty decor with the stainless plates, cups and serving dishes.

i'm a fan

I have nothing bad to say about this place. I'm a huuuuuge fan of Indian cuisine and I definitely got my itch scratched here. We were the first ones in for dinner service - I was a bit eager cuz I missed the lunch buffet - so we were told to sit wherever. The owner greeted us and we got water right away. The app came out pretty quickly, probably because we were the only ones there. 

The food was excellent, I wasn't disappointed by a single thing. I ordered an extra entree in case the portions were a bit small... There was no need, I didn't even finish the dhal which was what I really wanted. The aloo paratha could have used a bit more aloo for my taste but it wasn't a big deal.

For everything that we got, the bill was less than I expected, WIN! I'll definitely be back. Gotta catch the buffet next time cuz I tend to want everything on the menu.

Everything is fantastic in this restaurant..A new get together for all of my frenz.. :-) we had goat biryani..chicken tikka :-) and it was just deliiiciouss :-)
Buffet is one of the best in charlotte!
Service 5/5
Food 5/5
